163234543.review:
Unfortunately this is the worst roguelike topdown action game I've played. Its pacing is very off. The normal mobs move and attack extremely fast. Their attacks are very poorly telegraphed. There is no feedback when I get hit. So the game feels too fast. Yet, the bosses take 10 minutes to beat. They are such huge damage sponges that makes the gameplay feel boring at the boss stage. So odd! I would expected the bosses to go also ultra fast. In Hades, if I clear a mob room in 5-10 seconds, I can clear the boss room in 20, because the boss does not have 10,000x the hp of the mobs.

Your "hero" is boring. There is no variability as the game progresses. Once you choose your weapon, there is only "attack, dodge, spell". While playing the game I don't feel any impact of the progression, almost all of which comes as passive additions to your stats (plus attack, plus chance to cast thunder, plus damage from burn, ...).

Oddly, even though I've beaten all major roguelike action top-down games at the highest difficulty (eg hades, curse of the dead gods, ravenswatch, Isaac, ...), I am having real trouble playing this game on easy mode, due to the insane speed of the standard mob, the poor telegrapjing, and the lack of response when I get hit, so I at least understand that I got hit and learn from the event.

The multiplayer aspect doesn't matter. It doesn't add any benefit to the game, as there is nothing in the game that is altered when you play solo or with 4 players. There is no cross player synergy, or interaction. You cannot exchange items, and you can't choose future items by consulting other players, as the item choice is hidden. What a poor design decision. At least let us consult each other on what items we should get????

In short, playing this game with friends is a positive aspect of me having friends, not a positive aspect of the game itself. 

I am very surprised this has 90% rating. Ravenwatch is vastly superior when it comes to progression, hero variability, and gameplay feeling, so I would recommend that one instead.

the fun parts about this game got butchered by balance patches...

Old sword and hammer are dead, now you're left with slow, unfun weapons and awful relics that still exist in the pool untouched. Gee, thanks, game for the 1 hp every room, glad I have it. Let me also take 2 of the 6 viable spells out of a pool of like 30 while I'm at it too.

Not to mention the devs add more and more annoying achievements every update. There's a reason Vampire Survivors stopped doing that guys: [b]it sucks.[/b] I don't want to 100% a game 10 times because you feel the need to prey on the 100%ers instead of repairing the game that you personally gutted and butchered.

The only good thing about this game is that it has multiplayer- [i]which, if I might add,[/i] has on several occasions bugged out and caused me to get stuck behind invisible walls where we can't progress any further since it requires everyone at the door to go to the next room. [b]And guess what?[/b] [u]There's no hot-dropping. You can't leave and come back.[/u] What's that? You were an hour into an endless run? Oh well. See ya next time!

...
[b]Play [u]Revita[/u] instead.[/b]
They're struggling to keep the game afloat and it's way better than this junk will ever be.

I guess that in roguelite design challenge, where player have to die repeatedly and restart over, aside from skill issue, is how to make the death feels fair and not painful to player, meta progression upgrade gives hope to player that he can beat the boss next time, etc.

Which Ember Knight had done well, clear enemy telegraph, stat orbs that make you stronger (vs having to collect relic and synergies only), gradually unlock more OP relic into the game. Plus the ability to do multiplayer or remoteplay with friend made the game more fun.

TBH I tried the king of the roguelite game Ha*es (yep the one with 98% rating) but could not come to like it (I'm that 2% out of that remaining weird people), I found it too fast-paced and too much death frustration. I had to come back and appreciate Ember Knight design that somehow made stupid me finish it 19h through the game without giving up.

161001836.review:
Once again I'm stuck wishing Steam had a better recommendation system than simply yes or no. Is this game enjoyable? Yes. Is it worth the full price of $19.99? Hard to say, bust most likely not for most people. While the game is enjoyable it suffers from a few major issues that cause the repeatability to be low. First off... multiplayer is dead. You could try Discord or Steam forums but finding people to play with isn't going to be the easiest challenge. This game is more designed for co-op play than solo play. As a solo player it will be more challenging and progress will be slower. The progression of the game feels very grindy. Why? Because there's no real deviation in the progression. You face the same mini-bosses and bosses in order. You have map 1, map 2, map 3, etc. For speedrunners doing the same thing over and over and over is just part of the course... but if you're not a speedrunner than this could make you lose interest in the game after a few runs. 

If there was more progression unlocked each run it'd be fine. But even if you're able to consistently beat 2+ worlds each run it's just not much progression. There's only 6 weapons, which don't all feel that great, and your main progression goals are to unlock relic orbs, skill shards, and gain ember. Relic orbs unlock new relics (drops or room rewards) that give you active or passive abilities during your run. The skill shards are potential drops from mini-boss or bosses. These unlock new skills. You can, by default, have 2 skills you can gain during the run. The last progression are embers which let you unlock abilities. However these abilities are locked behind other requirements as well like having to invest X before unlocking or having to spend ember once in the tree to unlock alternate options. Basically it all boils down to meaning you're given an artificial grind to keep playing -- which is never a good look in a game.

With all that being said you'd think I'd have set my recommendation to a thumbs down. However... the game is fun. It just gets boring fast. But not all games need to be no-lifed. The download size is so small that I just pick this game up randomly from time to time and work on my progression. You take weeks or months for a break and the game feels fresh again... for a few more runs.

So while I think this game could drastically be improved with minor changes to the game... it's fun enough. I'd recommend getting it on a sale, it's not something you need to rush to buy, if you can. The game would be more fun if people actually played the multiplayer... but the game is dead. Not much you can do about it. I'm not surprised it's dead either.

159535912.review:
I've been playing this game for some time now, and I must say, it was more enjoyable during the beta phase. Many of the old relics have undergone changes and aren't as enjoyable as they once were. I understand why these changes were made—certain relics made it impossible to die, while others had broken scaling.

For instance, there used to be a relic that granted you a shield every time you perfected a skill. Now, if you perfect a skill, you have to wait 2 seconds. While this may seem like a minor nerf, those 2 seconds can significantly alter gameplay.

Another example is a legendary item that used to grant you attack power with every kill. Now, you have to get 4 kills to gain the same benefit.

Again, these changes aren't necessarily bad, but they do detract from the fun that was present during the beta phase. I remember breezing through the map in just 1 minute because I couldn't die—I had over 1000 damage and a speed of over 600; it was insane. Now, I feel like some of that excitement has been diminished, making it harder to achieve. It's still possible, but definitely more challenging.

Additionally, some weapons have been reworked, and honestly, I'm not a fan. The hammer feels boring now, and even the staff has undergone changes. I haven't checked the rest, but I'm a little disappointed they altered some of these items.

Because of this I am rather stuck as to what I want to say. I still enjoy the game, but I had way more fun with the older version then this one sadly.

Fun game to play co-op that I would not play alone. "Ending" is super anticlimatic. Attacks at latter stages are very poorly telegraphed so for someone who is not a very competent gamer you will have to hope for a god run buildwise to sustain the inevitable hits. Weapons are unlocked in such a pace you are only 4-5 runs in before you have the entire arsenal, upgrades to them feel mostly pointless and as an afterthought. Gameplay loop is very good and fun, the lore elements are atrocious and just such a pain to sit through while after each run. 

If this were less heavy on the shitty forced lore, had better telegraphed attacks, more diversity and actual usability in weapons you could have a very strong game here. There is hardly anything to do after you complete the game before the "true ending" which is frankly for most unobtainable and there is no carrot for you to spend any time at all playing with modifiers on. Go ranged if you don't want to suffer to the nasty hitboxes and surprise attacks!

158792765.review:
不值得这个价格。
原因如下：
游戏的难度曲线完全不平滑，第二层打起来感觉真的轻轻松松的，到第三层开始乏力，第四层开始刮痧打小怪磨血。然后小怪摸到玩家一下40-50血，而角色的血量顶多150-170。好在翻滚无敌帧很长，除了难度高一点总体影响不大
最重要的是游戏充斥着非常明显的不平衡，一旦你开始对游戏机制有一定的了解，你就会发现攻速这个属性非常重要，游戏内有非常多的圣物和攻速挂钩，攻速越快收益越大。然而这个极其重要的属性却完全由武器的基础属性所决定，游戏内绝无提升。各个流派之间强度差距也是相当大，我不知道为什么有的流派能轻松触发特效解决续航、控制、伤害等问题如同六边形战士。有的流派给个伤害数值都扣扣嗖嗖。
武器的设计更是完全的看不懂，蓄力攻击完全没有收益，大锤的蓄力比不续增加了一点可有可无的攻击范围和高达5点的伤害，刚开始玩时一二层数值高过其他武器许多，然后后续几乎没有圣物可以适配，只能叠个生命值打控制，打BOSS直接隐身。就是因为攻速不快不能快速触发暴击特效，所以没续航没伤害，甚至适配爆发的圣物都没几个。
我看了看抢鲜体验在2022年，2023年发售的游戏到现在还这个样子，除非后续大更新出更多圣物不然这个游戏攻速快的游戏永远是爹

I have no idea why this game isn't consistently mentioned in the same conversations as other top tier action roguelites (Hades, Deadcells, Dead Gods, etc.).  As someone who loves this genre, and has played dozens of quality titles in it, Ember Knights is easily in the top 3 of them all.  

I hate to dumb it down to "It's co-op Hades," but if that helps more people purchase the game and give it a shot, then it's worth it, because it really does feel like that!  For the record, it's completely playable and just as enjoyable solo - but you CAN play it with up to 4 people.

This was one of my top games of 2023, and I continue to play it both solo and with friends in 2024.  Please give it a look and thank you devs for making an all-time classic here.  I hope more people get word and check it out.

158020316.review:
Roguelite de acción rápida y combate simple, lo que no quita que esté bien pulido.

Teas el lanzamiento de versión 1.0 se han sacado actualizaciones importantes que amplían la progresión y las elecciones para cada run, y según el roadmap, aún quedan varias actualizaciones gordas, que vendrán seguidas de un DLC el cual estoy seguro que adquiriré.

A día de hoy, caben destacar las siguientes características.

- 7 armas para elegir para casa run. Las armas encadenan ataques y cuenran con ataques de carga.
- Mejoras de las armas previas a la run. 3 ramas de mejora con 3 nodos cada una, se elige 1 nodo por rama. Además hay un nodo de prestigio de cada arma.
- Árbol de pasivas, las cuales se pueden mejorar a conveniencia. En cada nodo de pasivas se elige una de tres posibilidades.
- Habilidades que de eligen durante la run. A día de hoy, se pueden elegir 2.
- Sistema de daño de elementos.
- Sistema de reliquias que se adquieren durante la run. Pueden aportar beneficiod como puntos de armadura, adquirir efectos al esquivar, añadir formas de curación, mejora de daño elemental...
- 5 mundos, con un boss y un miniboss por mundo, salvo el último, cuya mecánica de mundo tiene ciertas diferencias con los otros.
- Sistema de dificultad ajustable tras completar la primera run.
- Modo infinito, bien integrado con el sistema de dificultad.
- Progresión variada e interesante.

En mi opinión, bien vale los 20 euros. En mi caso, me sirve como un "Hades" (respecto a jugabilidad, la historia de EK es una excusa para disfrutar unas mecánicas bien hechas, no un fin en sí misma) ya que tiene cierto aire, si bien usa su propia fórmula y encaja de manera exquisita los elementos clave del juego.

157927528.review:
400 gramas de camarão

Sal e pimenta a gosto

2 litros de caldo de peixe ou caldo de camarão

110 gramas de manteiga (20 gramas para fritar o camarão e 90 gramas para o risoto)

1/2 cebola picada

1 dente de alho picado

1/4 de pimenta-dedo-de-moça (opcional)

150 gramas de tomate picado e sem semente

200 gramas de arroz para risoto (pode ser o arbóreo, carnarolli ou outro)

60 ml de vinho branco seco

70 gramas de queijo parmesão

Salsinha picada
modo de preparo
Reúna todos os ingredientes
Em uma tigela, coloque o camarão para marinar com sal e pimenta por cerca de 10 minutos
Leve uma panela ao fogo médio, aqueça o caldo de peixe ou de frango e mantenha-o quente
Em uma frigideira no fogo médio, frite os camarões na manteiga. Deixe-os bem rosadinhos dos dois lados e reserve
Em uma panela de fundo grosso, também em fogo médio, coloque 30 gramas da manteiga e refogue (sem dourar) a cebola e o alho
Acrescente a pimenta e o tomate, refogue-os e mexa de pouco em pouco
Quando os tomates estiverem quase desmanchando, acrescente o arroz e misture
Coloque o vinho e mexa até que o líquido da panela esteja próximo de secar
Junte 4 conchas do caldo de peixe (quentes) ao arroz e continue mexendo. Quando o líquido da panela estiver quase secando, adicione mais 4 conchas do caldo. Repita o processo até que o arroz fique bem macio
Quando o arroz estiver chegando ao ponto ideal de cozimento, adicione o camarão frito (reserve alguns para finalizar o prato), misture e desligue o fogo
Coloque o parmesão e mexa até ele derreter. Se precisar, acerte o sal e a pimenta
Deixe o risoto descansar por cerca de 2 a 3 minutos. Adicione a salsinha, mexa
é isso

157908298.review:
千万不要为这个游戏的可爱美术所吸引，这个游戏就是一坨金玉其外败絮其中的屎。
这个游戏唯二讨喜的优点就是美术和联机服务的通畅了。
接下来说说它的缺点：
首先，黄金量少得可怜，局内无瑕的情况下也只有小概率给钱，没有获得打钱圣物两件套之前钱永远是缺的。尾王战的房间里必然有几间对自己的强度毫无提升的房间，技能转换器这种东西跳过选择居然没有任何奖励。
绝大多数伤害类圣物的成长性基本为0，只为单轮通关准备，无尽开始圣物提供的作用基本就只有特效酷炫和控制。
武器严重不平衡，在这个只提倡无伤的游戏里居然有很多武器的充能攻击是罚站和接近罚站的高额减速？？？某些武器想通关高难只有BD天胡，而某些武器只需要点到即止便可闲庭信步。
镰刀游龙的局换成法杖搓到腱鞘炎勉强可过。
诅咒类型的圣物多为高风险低回报让人根本没有想拿的欲望，生命之泉这样的房间后期要么不够用要么用不到，然而尾王房还是有概率给你塞几个无价值的房间让你任选其一。
本地化基本可以断定是机翻，很多词条如果不自己中译英英译中根本逻辑都不通顺。
难度曲线不合理，很有可能出现一步选错或者运气不好导致一整把体验都非常坐牢（指人脆攻低怪肉攻高）的恶性连锁反应。多人的数值还要比单人牢上一等。
高情商：鼓励全程无伤 低情商：数值脚填的
有些选择的收益曲线非常非常不平滑，大部分圣物带来的效果都是辅助为主，并且辅助圣物之间也需要关键的拼图来构成有价值的BD。玩到目前成型之后也很爽快的只有雷电系Build。大家都要糊才能混得好的情况下带来的联机体验必定是三人养一人或者多人ob一个蝗虫的局面。
内容极度贫瘠，BOSS只有精英怪的变体和相同的boss战，地图也是重复的。这点希望后续更新能做得好一些。
回复类圣物少且条件苛刻，一把有没有回复类圣物体验相差可说是天上地下。
近战怪十个里十一个是粪怪，从威茨伯里到内瑟拉开始更是极致的粪怪扎堆。
前期圣物解锁量不足和武器没有解锁改装的时候内容非常贫瘠，武器改装更是意义不明，不是带来强度上的质变而是带来更严重的不平衡。
如果没有三个好朋友或者三个奴隶不建议买这个游戏，因为留下的只会有你小概率快乐大概率痛苦的回忆。

157528885.review:
> Ingredientes do bolo de cenoura com chocolate
3 cenouras em pedaços
1 xícara (chá) de óleo
3 ovos
2 xícaras (chá) de açúcar
3 xícaras (chá) de farinha de trigo
1 colher (sopa) de fermento em pó
Margarina e farinha de trigo para untar
> Cobertura
1/2 lata de leite condensado
1 colher (sopa) de manteiga
4 colheres (sopa) de chocolate em pó
1/2 xícara (chá) de creme de leite
> Modo de preparo
No liquidificador, bata a cenoura, o óleo, os ovos e o açúcar até ficar homogêneo. Transfira para uma tigela, adicione a farinha, o fermento e misture com uma colher. Despeje em uma fôrma de buraco no meio de 24cm de diâmetro, untada e enfarinhada, e leve ao forno médio, preaquecido, por 35 minutos ou até assar e dourar. Retire, deixe amornar e desenforme. Para a cobertura, em uma panela, leve o leite condensado, a manteiga e o chocolate em pó ao fogo médio, mexendo até engrossar. Desligue, adicione o creme de leite e misture. Espalhe sobre o bolo para servir.

This is one of the best roguelite multiplayer games out there!  Even in single player mode, it's still pretty fun! 

Loads of weapons and skills to choose from.  Even more relics to choose from and unlock.  Once you begin unlocking the relics, it begins to peel back all of the possibilities of build stacking and making your guy nigh unstoppable.  Start off with your first attack always laying down a crit.  Then get another relic that allows your crit to have a 25% chance of lightening strikes.  Then another relic that creates a lightening orb that comes from your lightening strikes.  Suddenly you have a guy that is zapping enemies left and right with little lightening balls running around hurting everything around you! 

If you ever liked playing games with your buddies, then you'll love playing with them in Ember Knights.

156216195.review:
I like it, it's a decent base game for a rogue-like. I liked it enough to get all of the achievements and unlocks, and still play it just to see how far I can get with different setups. You could do worse for $20 bucks, but you could also do better - the game still needs some more time in the oven to patch out some things (endless mode tends to glitch from time to time as an example), and there are other rogue-likes that currently bring more to the table due to being out longer (Risk of Rain 2 being a good example, and games like Vampire Survivors being $5 bucks). If you like high-paced action and the flow of rogue-likes, you'll like this game.

The Good:

- Solid adventure mode
- Tons of stuff to unlock via secrets
- Challenging, will not hold your hand
- Up to 4 player co-op, but fun as well solo
- Easy to learn, and always fun finding new combos
- No need to grind, any time you want to pick it up you can get right back to it
- Replay-ability is good

The Bad:

- Game still needs some bugs ironed out. Endless Mode sometimes bugs out.
- The lack of multiple worlds, and that the worlds follow the same path over and over, make the roguelike a bit too predictable.
- With the amount of stuff enemies throw at you, along with having multiple players, can make it very easy to lose track of where you are which can cause getting hit or getting death a constant issue.
- A lot of stuff seems to be a bit unbalanced. If you see crit-healing mentioned a lot, this is one of those unbalances. I also notice the "First hit in room" items/powers are underwhelming compared to their counterparts or other options.
- The UI could use a redo, having it at the bottom covering parts of the screen, or fading making it hard to determine if my skills are charged, makes it very unhelpful.

Suggestions for the game:

- A randomizer challenge option would be a great addition. Shuffling the worlds, enemies, and bosses in an endless mode would be a fun way to shake things up. Even make relics and powers random!
- Please reassign the UI somewhere else for the player's health/skills. The upper right hand corner for all players would be nice, and perhaps making it a bit smaller could also help. Can we please also have the players name's above their respective characters to help with keeping track of players, and maybe a small "Super Smash Bros" icon bubble for players of screen to help keep track of our team.
- A rebalance of some relics and powers please - The "First hit in room" stuff needs some form of revamp or major buffs, and healing needs a look at too please - crit-glove should not be the only viable means of progression in Endless mode; perhaps reassign the crit glove as an Ember Tree option along with a couple other choices for healing, and maybe make an Ember Tree option for "First hit in room" to help buff those options (FHIR can apply twice, FHIR have a chance of reactivating, etc.) Soul Siphon could also use some love.
- Bonus in-between areas after a boss fight would be cool, being able to fight a room full of both the previous world and upcoming worlds enemies for goodies would be cool, plus I would like to see how certain enemies from other world factions fight alongside each other.
- Please give us a use for Ash after we have unlocked everything, we still have the rooms pop up even with Ash maxed out.

Overall, I can see this game having a bright future, as the devs do respond in the Steam Discussions, and I can see both DLC and updates being something this game will have. Keep up the good work, Doom Turtle, I look forward to seeing where Ember Knights goes :)

155978562.review:
玩了 44 小时，已经全成就了。不错的肉鸽小作品，玩的很爽。游戏配置不算很高，色彩设计挺不错，搭配好不花眼。更难得是他不仅能本地多人游玩，还能联机！这能让他再续命一段时间。

    该游戏的缺点也是挺明显的，就是内容少，难度个人感觉每个世界跨度挺大的。

    先说前者，Ember knights 仅有 20 个技能，除非你实力很强、很熟悉怪的攻击方式，不然有一部分技能是真的没什么用的，而冰球和小旋风几乎都是二选一必带的。道具有 100 个出头，如果你想打到游戏后期，那个加恢复的是一定要带的，希望后期更新能出多点（毕竟你游戏定价 70 多啊，这技能和道具的内容我真感觉不值）。

    对于后者，游戏难度的断层挺多，一周目中，第一世界和第二世界难度都差不多，可第三层开始就有明显拉高，第四、五世界也稍微有一点，这种跨度在二周目中表现尤其明显，给我感觉就是玩的很奇怪，明明一开始能随便秒杀，但突然就怎么打都打不死的感觉。

    关于难度，我认为二周目的第二世界的 boss 应该去当一周目的最终 boss，无他，真的恶心，在他那死三次。

155971431.review:
Oh man, where do I even begin? This game was an absolute blast to play through. The art is beautiful, the character design felt really nice, and the music is top notch. If you're new to rouge-lites the gameplay might be tough at first because this game is actually really challenging, but with enough patience you can quickly learn each enemies' attack patterns. Each world is unique and has a good variety of different enemy types. The world bosses are tough at first, but the real challenge begins when you unlock their variants. Each boss's variant is an extra type of pain, but nothing gets tougher than Blizzard Brauma. As a few others have said in their reviews, he's the true final boss. If you're unlucky enough to encounter him, your run will either end abruptly or be in a critical position after beating him. When it comes to the Skills and Relics the game has to offer, there's something for everyone. 

On the topic of Relics, that's where my biggest issue with the game comes in. Sure, there's a ton of Relics and the builds you can create are vast, but one of the [i]only[/i] viable builds you can use to complete a run most of the time is Crit-Heal. It's unbelievably busted and you really need a way to heal almost constantly because of how much damage enemies do late game. Aside from that, the only other irritation I had with the game was the way of obtaining more colors for the Embers. There are a few that you can unlock by completing runs in specific ways, whether that be your first run, a run on endless mode, or by completing a run with the difficulty modifiers all the way up. However, to get [i]every[/i] color will require a large amount of luck and patience. Every world has a secret room that can only be opened by using a specific skill. Not only do you need to get lucky and obtain the skill needed [i]before[/i] that room appears, but you [i]also[/i] have to hope and pray the room even spawns. It was a huge pain in the ass to accomplish this, but I eventually succeeded (around 40 runs) and got that achievement. This might be a lot easier to do in multiplayer, but I didn't have that luxury because the online seems to be dead at the time of writing this review. I did get to play one run of multiplayer with my buddies, and lemme tell ya, it was such a chaotically fun time.

Overall, this game gets a 9/10 from me and I'd recommend it to anyone who enjoys rouge-lites and/or just likes playing games with friends. Whether you play solo or with others, you're in for a jolly good time with this one!

155651115.review:
The game is a solid 8/10 imo, it's a lot of fun and definitely challenging to play this hades co-op game, but I think the game's biggest issue is how much you are expected to have healing. Skill definitely plays a role, the more you can dodge the better off you will be. But in the later stages the enemies deal 50+ damage on a single hit so if you don't have substantial healing you can easily die in 3-4 hits from full health.

So sure, we can all agree that healing is good, but the items you can get from healing early game are very limited. You have an item where you heal when you enter a room (1/room, pretty lame on its own), critical hits heal, and food you find lying around. If you don't get at least 1 healing item, your run is going to be hard. I think I've only beaten a run without a healing item once so far, and that's because I did an armored build.

Ways I suspect it could be fixed would be to reward you for going for an armored build where all armor related items help you stack armor higher (right now, if you have two armor giving items such as the relic that gives 1 armor when you kill an enemy and another relic that gives 5 armor if  you achieve a perfect skill use, you can have a max of 15 armor because both items only give that as a max) I'd rather it be something where if you have 4 different level 1 relics that give armor or rely on armor for boost, you get a max of 30 armor, 15 for the first relic, and +5 for each subsequent armor related relic. 

Still, even if my personal gripe doesn't get fixed, the game is a great purchase and a lot of fun with friends. I still plan on 100% completing the game, it's that fun.

155633314.review:
TL;DR; This is a great game to play with friends, and the online co-op experience is awesome. Not a ton of replayability or content once you’ve figured out the game. For experienced rogueliters, this should take a few days at most. Steam deck experience is great.

We were able to get the final ending on Hard within a couple of days, which was a little disappointing. Like another reviewer said, some classes and items are questionable and sustain seems to be necessary after a certain point. 

Having win conditions is fine, and having certain builds be better than others is also fine. These are things that are endemic to roguelites in general. However, the issue with Ember Knights is that the win conditions and better builds seem to be painfully limited to a select few variants. This damps down on the game’s replayability. Once you’ve had “the run”, there’s not much point in trying to replicate that experience with other builds and/or characters.

Now, it’s a new game and I haven’t put in a ton of time experimenting. I could be missing something here. Regardless, short of doing mini speed runs, I don’t see a reason to pick this one back up. Hopefully the planned updates give me a reason to.

155551514.review:
I am in two minds about the game.

On one hand, it's a nice action platformer. It has some concepts which make it interesting.

For example, you only get one (iniitially) life to play through the whole content. Coupled with sparse healing possibilities in the 4 worlds you play, this gives a challenge. 

As you play you gain more hp, damage and other stats, and unlock skills and relics, which you can then get randomly from specific rooms in the worlds during your next playthroughs. All stats, skills and relics disappear upon death/quit, so each next playthrough you supposedly start from 0, except blue coins (earned during play) which you keep.

The blue coins can be used to permanently improve your initial setup /specifics at Ember tree in the start of the game (such as unlocking abilities to revive up to 3 times in a playthrough, etc).

When you finish the game on initial difficulty, the ante is raised, with unlocking new (choosable) difficulty levels. You then can grind for weapon upgrades, and use them together with skills and relics to get great combos helping make playthroughs a satisfying breeze.

So far very good. If you finish the content in the one run, you get option to continue next run keeping all your stats, skills and relics. 

All in all, a decent way to squeeze a lot of replaybility out of really not very much content.

Unfortunately the focus on adding new relics and skills, instead of new maps, is the biggest drawback for the game. 

By now there are so many relics and skills to choose from, that your chance on getting a good combo is tiny. And *without* getting a good combo, you can easily die completely in the first world even if you've maxed all your weapon and Ember tree options (which are the only permanent improvements). Point in fact, I wanted to grab some points for relic buying, and toned the difficulty to simple +50%, ... and died completely (ie used up my 3 half lives) on the boss of the 4d world.

Nowadays, I frequently run the game through first 3 (easier) worlds just to see if I manage to get a good combo of relics and skills to go on. If not, I will simply try to earn enough blue coins to recoup my expenses (you can unlock option to purchase some random relics for them at start of game as well), and quit.

So, the annoying thing is that even if you've finished all content and maxed everything, you are still at mercy of randomness for your chance to have a satisfying "I've maxed it, now I can just cut through things like a knife" feeling. Even at minimum difficulty.

The feeling is very frustrating for me and for that reason, I still mark the game as one I do not recommend, even though I have played it quite enough. I might still play it occasionally, but I can't honestly recommend a casino-type timesink as something good.

155352657.review:
Honestly, I fucking hate this game with my guts. It looks nice, it feels good at first, but the more you play the more frustrating it gets:
1. Upgrading health doesn't really help with survival because enemies always hit you hard and destroy the same part of your health all the time. In the beginning you start with 80 hp, they hit you for 8. Late game you have 200 hp, they hit you for 32. Thus the only thing that really helps with survival is crazy dodging all the time. But here goes the issue number 2
2. The more abilities you collect, the more hellish your screen gets. In late game you cannot see what's going on on the screen because of all the lightnings and lasers and other crazy stuff. It makes dodging very hard. How could you dodge something you couldn't even see? I have 150+ hours in Hades and I had never have any issue of the sort
3. Disconnects in coop can and will ruin your run. You get good gear with your friend, you make the best run so far and then you get disconnected and there's no way to connect back. The button for reconnection disappears after the first click and never comes back

The only way to truly enjoy this game is to get lucky and collect gear for healing early enough so you upgrade it before the run gets too difficult. It would allow you to finally stop crazy dodging all the time and safely take some hits. Though you'll still have to pray for connection stability if you play coop

155179630.review:
If i could give an honest opinion, it would be somewhere between a thumbs up and a thumbs down.

I bought the game to play with a friend only recently (December, 2023) which was after the terrible, no good update other negative reviews have mentioned. We play on easy mode since my friend has never done a game like this before, and even after 10 hours of gameplay, we are still having a tough time playing. We still get far as I'm more experienced, but it's no fun if one of us is constantly dead for long periods of time. Here is a non exhaustive list of things we have noticed that are causing us issues;

Overpowered enemies - 
Enemies (and bosses, for that matter) feel way overpowered. It's not as noticeable in the earlier worlds, but I find from world 3 onward, if you don't have a good armor or heal build, you're dead with just a couple ill-timed hits. The divide between enemy damage and relic healing is so absurd, you better get real good at perfecting rooms. This seems to be the main issue brought up by other negative reviewers.

Enemies do not flinch -
Since enemies hit really hard compared with how much health you have, the fact that they can cruise right through your attacks until you finally kill them is incredibly frustrating, especially with slow, close-combat weapons like the hammer. Good luck if you want to try playing the tank, there's basically no point.

Dodging/rolling feels delayed - 
Both my friend and I agree that dodging feels delayed in that we still get hit despite having visually (on-screen) dodged the attack. It's hard to explain properly but it's still something I've noticed while in the middle of playing. It is also a very short distanced dodge so good luck with the bigger boss enemies or enemies with wider-spread attacks.

Bullet hell - 
If you are planning on playing with friends, be aware that later worlds quickly become a mess with enemies and constant attacks flying across your screen. Lingering attacks hoard available play space and your character can easily get caught in corners or on crevice edges in the middle of the arena. Essentially, our poor movement speed and short dodge distance often can't handle the barrage of enemies and attacks. Attacks also seem to overlap in that there are times where it is virtually impossible to evade without getting hit since there is nowhere to go that won't GET YOU HIT. This is felt especially with worlds 5 and 6 where I alone (my friend had no chance of surviving) only survived as long as I did because I made some stupid build with armor + perfect skill healing build (+ the dice skill which healed me on good rolls). I WAS ONLY ALIVE BECAUSE I WAS BASICALLY INVINCIBLE. The fact that successful runs are so restricted to having one of few good builds really takes the fun out of the game.

All in all, this is not to say that you won't have fun playing. The foundations for a really good game are here, and it's not like there aren't people praising Ember Knights! It's still enjoyable and the art is gorgeous, we love our little fire guys... but if I wanted to play a game like this that didn't feel totally unforgiving, I'd just play Hades :/

I want to love this game so badly. It has everything, and I mean everything, to be an absolute banger.
Graphics? Cute, colorful, charming. Great artstyle I love it. Outside of bosses the screen gets rarely so scattered that you lose yourself.

What makes push the "Do not buy" button is the fact, that this game randomly crashes after bosses. I can't find a fix for it, the common tricks won't do and I seem not to be the only one to have this issue. 

An unpolished gem with a major crack in it... So sad, because this game COULD be gold.

154783476.review:
While I want to be kind to this game for being as fun as it was during early access, a lot has changed with the release of the game. Not a lot of it positive in my eyes.

1) Many of the fun ways to play the weapons has been altered or made much harder to achieve. The hammer dodge jump? Removed for being too much fun. Now the hammer is incredibly clunky and confusing as to why it even exists. Ah, yes, I would like to play the SLOW MOVING, CHARGING WEAPON CLASS in a game where life or death comes down to less than a tenth of a second. Do you play your own game or is there a joke I'm missing somewhere? How many armor items do you need to acquire to make completely immobile, attacking-once-every-two-second gameplay viable? Likewise, the blender sword build has been removed and replace with a single spin slash. But now it has fire. Exciting to the three players left who actually use the fire status, I'm sure.

2) The majority of the relics are bafflingly bad."Hmm, would I rather heal every single time I cast a spell for 2, or heal for 1 every time I finish a room? Gee, game, this is a hard choice. Why not invalidate both options and just gain 5 armor on every spell cast? Which is health, but better?" Sure, healing items have synergies that can work together to make an undying monster, but I want ANYONE to find a justification for an item that heals a SINGLE health point upon ENTERING a new room. Go ahead. An entire relic slot that takes 5 rooms to be as useful as an apple. It's funny, to say the least.

3) The final world is horribly designed. I have no other way to describe it. The boss mechanic being horribly telegraphed lasers that do 20 damage less than 0.2 seconds after a telegraph, in a room full on enemies that can and will do 45+ damage per hit, and then having that laser be spammed 10 times just to make sure it hits the player at least once? Yeah. Good job. The massive orbs aren't much better, doing 27 damage and taking up an unreasonable amount of the screen space. If it was the ONLY thing I had to worry about? Sure. No problem. BUT AGAIN, the 6th's world's scaling makes it impossible to avoid everything.

4) Healing is now required, and is no longer a suggestion. I used to run through the whole game without any healing relics, as a fun challenge for myself. Now? Good luck. Bosses have been given extra attacks that fill the screen with clutter so that at least SOMETHING will hit you, enemies are more aggressive, and safer playstyles have been nerfed or limited. Every single build I make now has to have, at minimum, a way to heal 30 health on demand, because that is how much the most basic enemy does in worlds 5 and 6. Before ANY modifiers to make that worse. That means every single build has to be a crit build or an armor build unless you play flawlessly. So every build needs at least 2 crit heal gloves, 2 juicy opals... and while we're at it, we might as well weaponize the healing, so... let's grab a scythe. Now that we have sustain AND healing, we might as well get some armor, to weaken any hits we take while healing. So armor boots or perfect cast armor wand. 2 of each would be ideal. Damn, no more room for damage artifacts? Oh well. At least I can survive a few hits from the enemies now. Didn't get any damage or crit crystals, though? Just end the run. It's done. After all, surviving the enemies doesn't matter if you can't kill them. For those that don't believe me? Try a run with the bow and spreadshot. Get crit heal gloves. Get a juicy opal. Get heal berries. And watch as you heal over 30 health every second. Congratulations, you have unlocked video game reviewer mode and the only build that can facetank any amount of damage in world 6.

5) New boss changes are not enjoyable. Early bosses have been given massive increases to either their HP, damage, or new mechanics that can and will clip you. Boss variants are just straight up unreasonable to deal with and seem to have lost the understanding of what made the miniboss variants fun. The boss variants don't add a new gameplay twist, they simply remove the weaknesses they had and give them a huge set of new attacks that are both unenjoyable to deal with and epitomize the problem with modern gaming: Why make a fun encounter when I can just make my boss invulnerable and swarm them with summons that do nothing to the boss's health bar? Everyone loves when the boss just inexplicably becomes invulnerable and chooses when you can hit them. We used it a little before, but NOW we can put it on ALL OF THEM. However, nothing epitomizes this problem like world 2's boss variant: Between each phase shift, he teleports to his throne. On normal, this lasts about 10 seconds. You can rush him and take advantage of blind spots to give yourself free damage time when it ends and he emotes. On altered? He stays invulnerable for as long as it takes you to defeat 20 summons. That's right, a reasonable TWENTY enemies. While being attacked every single second by the boss. It is so bad it makes me angry.

If Brugal is the poster child, Poltergeist might be the worst boss I have ever played in any video game. I beat it first try with my wife, and neither of us lost a life, but we were both so annoyed by it that we put our controllers down and went off to do something else. The entire fight is nothing but a series of rotating summons that do almost nothing to you. You just have your time on this earth taxed into nothingness. Did you not kill the summons FAST ENOUGH? Good news! The boss can immediately re-enter the invulnerability and summon the EXACT SAME SUMMONS as soon as it ends. It is a literal run killer if you got unlucky with damage pick ups. (Who designs garbage like this and is proud of it?)

If by some miracle the game developer reads this? Here's your TL;DR : Stop adding invulnerability phases to your boss fights. If you're going to have summons, they need to share a health pool with the boss. NOTHING, and I mean NOTHING, is more frustrating than being given a meaningless chore in the middle of an otherwise entertaining encounter. Bosses deciding it isn't your turn to hit them has never been engaging in any video game. It never will be. You remove any and all nuance to a fight by doing this. I can't choose to risk taking more damage and attacking when I know I shouldn't. I can't choose to do anything other than wait or do the homework given to me by the boss.

154770790.review: The latest update significantly increased the game's difficulty, even on the default setting. Previously, I enjoyed casual runs, managing well with half the difficulty bar. Now, however, even at the base difficulty and without additional mods, we're forced to adopt high-effort strategies and select the best weapon mods to stand a chance. The update has overpowered every mob, adding numerous extra attacks. In multiplayer, this transforms the game into an almost bullet-hell scenario, making it exceedingly tough to avoid getting hit. The challenge escalates as mobs target multiple players, leading to situations where dodging one attack results in colliding with another aimed at a teammate. This has turned the game into a frustrating and overly difficult experience at its core level. It would have been more user-friendly to offer an optional setting to alter mob attack patterns, rather than altering the fundamental difficulty of the base game.

154545680.review:
《余烬骑士》是一款适合单人和合作游戏的动作rogue游戏。玩家需要在这个被巫师威胁的宇宙中扮演烈焰骑士，与腐化进行一次又一次的斗争。游戏像素风格的视觉和艺术呈现比元气骑士与挺进地牢都更为精细，艺术风格给人的感觉十分生动活泼。

[h1][quote=]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]　欢迎关注 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38287879]网易UU鉴赏家培养计划[/url][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]　极速畅玩，联机日友，加速社区，记得来UU哦_(:з」∠)_　[/th]    
   [/tr]

[/table]
[/quote][/h1]

[h1]游戏机制[/h1]
游戏的核心是其快节奏的动作rogue玩法。玩家可以从六种独特的武器中选择，每种武器有九种改造、17种技能和85种遗物，允许创造数百种独特的构筑，使得玩家可以有不同的游戏风格（近战或施法），例如可以组合毒素、火焰和魔法技能，利用特定的遗物和法杖武器创造大范围的伤害。战斗需要一些技巧和时机，才可以达到构筑的最大效果，如通过精准的操作和策略选择来强化战斗效果。敌人和Boss设计方面，本作拥有超过60种独特的怪物和Boss，每种都有独特的攻击和行为，战斗体验还算可以。

与其他同类型的游戏相比较，游戏在深度上有所欠缺，其主要特色在于对合作模式的支持。本作强调的是合作游戏体验，支持多达4名玩家同时进行游戏。这种重点放在多人合作上的设计在rogue游戏中相对少见，为玩家提供了独特的团队协作和策略制定机会。合作游戏中，玩家之间的构筑有互动，玩家的构筑选择不仅影响个人游戏体验，也会影响整个队伍的策略和效率。这要求玩家在选择技能和遗物时不仅考虑个人优势，还要考虑团队协作和资源分配。

[h1]总结[/h1]
《余烬骑士》对于rogue类型游戏在联机玩法上有着不错的补充，提供了引人入胜的游戏玩法与多样化的构建选项。尽管其深度可能需要后续更新中好好挖掘。但对于那些寻找合作体验的玩家而言，目前游戏的构筑选项与战术的多样性，结合程序生成的关卡和多人合作的设计，足够使其在rogue游戏中独树一帜，因此值得尝试。

153524484.review:
Pixelart Hades-style roguelike that just keeps getting better. This game oozes style and the recent update just seals the deal. 
Meta progression is unlocking and specializing weapons. The variety of playstyles in the weapon talents is huge, each weapon feels unique to use, and the in-universe reason for unlocking stuff is cute. 
Runs are 5 stages, eventually to be 6, and now loop over with variations on the OG boss fights to mix things up in Endless mode. 
Beating the final boss unlocks a Hades-style run mutator to ratchet up the challenge in different ways than just bigger numbers, and there are now a bunch of secret costmetic unlocks hidden throughout the stages, some even requiring certain drafted skills to unlock. 

tl;dr, 
Game big, game good.

153309662.review:
In case you haven't heard enough, it's basically Hades + co-op if not better. Whether you have friends over or want to play online, this game has got you covered.

Love the theme and variety in Ember Knights. Phenomenal art style. I sincerely enjoyed the upgrades and weapons and look forward unlocking more of what this game offers. There are lots of play styles, and all of them feel fun on its own right. The game is challenging, but funny enough - does not feel frustrating.

Ember Knights is a game that feels very polished and built with passion. Truly one heck of a game.

153190511.review:
Se vi piacciono i roguelite, e ne cercavate uno da fare in coop, [b]Ember Knights[/b] riproduce gli schemi del genere in modo eccezionale.
𝙋𝙚𝙧 𝙢𝙚 𝙪𝙣𝙖 𝙙𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙚 𝙢𝙞𝙜𝙡𝙞𝙤𝙧𝙞 𝙨𝙘𝙤𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙩𝙚 𝙙𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙚 𝙧𝙚𝙩𝙧𝙤𝙫𝙞𝙚 𝙧𝙤𝙜𝙪𝙚.

Presentando con efficienza la semplicità, [b]Ember Knights[/b] riesce dove altri roguelites cercano di fare il passo più lungo della gamba, creando una sfida intensa attraverso build generose, per un divertimento sempre crescente e accessibile.

E' un gioco a cui non importa della trama o avere colonne sonore incredibili. Vuole solo rendere l'esperienza piacevole, con una progressione decisa a far crescere il gameplay di volta in volta.
In multiplayer è favoloso.

[u]Potrebbe essere la svolta roguelite che stavate cercando.[/u]

Ніби награв 50 годин і маю похвалити гру, але я скоріш розчарований в ній😔 50 годин не міг вбити фінального боса і нарешті вбиваю, а там мені кажуть: "Чувак, ти канєшно харош шо прошов його, але попробуй пройди його знову з усиленням в рази 2-3, бо він там попав в якись інший вимір🙄". Моя хонест реакшин на це була звісно ж така🥰😋😘🤗. До цього на годині 30-й майже виніс його, оставивши при цьому хп на один удар буквально🤬 Як я зрозумів - вони в останній обнові усилили енеміс в два рази по хп і урону, а чуваки до цього просто легко проходили і забирали всі достіги😨🤯

В грі контенту на годин 20-30 точно; непогана музика; дуже багато різних білдів; 100+ реліквій; близько 20-ти навиків; багато енеміс і декілька нпс; 6 оружок і скоро 7-а прибуде, АЛЕ для мене це вже не так і важливо...

152993003.review:
好玩 联机版哈迪斯 和朋友玩很快乐 下面是个人评价
蹦蹦炸弹过于超模 范围大伤害高 我不知道制作组为什么搞一个这么超模的技能 让其他的技能黯淡无光
dot流仍需加强 随机性很大 回血流更是快乐 顶着打不会死 
来评一下弓箭的完美蓄力后增加蓄力箭数目的武器技能
我的评价为 机制很好 但是当我注意到蓄力箭的威力只有正常的三分之一 它就变成了一坨答辩
简而言之就是，我需要完美蓄力三次后 三发散射箭全中 加起来才等于不点这个天赋所造成的蓄力箭伤害
首先这个游戏就需要不断的闪避 连续完美蓄力的操作就很难 结果获得的收益不增反降 这是什么设计？
再点上第三排的爆炸蓄力的武器天赋 那特效是相当唬人 帅的没边 输出却像挠痒痒
我建议弓箭完美蓄力次数越多 造成的伤害越高 不然你搁那完美X99 除了装比毫无意义 看到可怜的输出更是气不打一处来
ps:(感觉加强版最终boss不如.....疾风骤雨-布鲁玛)

152857438.review:
还行吧，或者说单人玩的话对于我来说除了弓，其他我通不了关。武器设计貌似有问题，其他的方面还好吧，不是特别能让人爽起来。
技能的完美释放判定完全是在难为玩家，为了所谓的操作而做的多余的设计，影响节奏

作为一个100个小时的玩家，我不得不改好评为差评

作为一个肉鸽游戏，圣物、技能也就那两个能用，其他都是垃圾

作为一个魂类游戏，严重依赖翻滚保命，但是地图的障碍物过多，堆怪严重，怪物攻击欲望强烈，强烈到什么程度呢，就是砍一刀就要马上翻滚的那种

作为一个养成游戏，武器的升级简直尼玛离谱，全都是和build不搭嘎的，游戏的蓄力系统简直尼玛我要是产品经理，直接打爆这个策划的狗头。

就这样吧，10小时前好评，之后就可以卸载了，或者体验一下如果退款前还不能让你爽，那就果断退吧，后面没有惊喜

151681369.review:
玩了36H來個評論~

1.新下載遊戲的玩家建議別玩技能型法杖，前期聖物都還沒開啟的時候會極度痛苦沒遊戲體驗，等聖物開啟7-8成的時候會有比較好的表現。

2.多人一起遊玩可考慮把資源堆在一名玩家身上，一個人帶輔助類的聖物 (完美施放技能給予冰凍 / 暈眩 的聖物等等..)  ;  技能(冰凍 / 颶風 / 黑洞 / 骰子)，會比較好通關。

3.目前遊戲關卡跟技能真的不算多 (5大關 / 20招技能)，後續玩法就是關卡boss變異型態增加一些新的攻擊模式還有可以自己設定難度而已，只能等後續更新關卡跟技能。

4.技能目前好用的就某幾個，有些技能高充能基礎傷害過低又沒有什麼輔助性質的功能，選幾次玩玩就不會想選擇了。

5.我想跟製作組說: 把法杖原本的減少完美充能速度拔掉，就不能加進去聖物裡面給玩家選擇嗎? 拔掉充能速度超影響手感的

151181646.review:
I'd rather not do a negative review, but I am very disappointed with the changes in the last patch.  I would've made this a post or maybe even brought it up in the Discord, but I'm not interested in having my voice drowned out by apologists.

I was looking forward to weapons becoming more flexible and viable with a variety of builds, but instead you doubled down and are (in a way) forcing us to play using charge attacks for almost all weapons.  Charge attacks (no matter how good they are) do not lend themselves to the fast paced nature of this game where if you blink - you die.  My friends that I play with were so disappointed with the changes that they lost all interest in playing at all and simply turned off the game before starting a run.  I did however do a solo run with the sword to test the changes and the game just felt more difficult somehow, I felt like like I was completely at the mercy of RNG, there was even a room where it turned into bullet hell and I did not have a single moment to breathe.  I don't understand why the designer(s) of this game want to make the game punishingly unfair, but congratulations, it feels brutal and not in a fun way.  The weapon mods in the previous patch were not perfect, but there was some good choices, now the only choices that were viable previously have been completely removed and/or changed for the worse, in favor of providing a more "challenging" experience.  I don't know who is asking to make the game more difficult, but it's definitely not my friends and I.  It feels like the only weapon that received a straight upgrade was the Bow.  The scythe, hammer, sword, staff and chakram were just down right nerfed in their utility and build viability in favor of charge attacks.

I'm no stranger to challenges and difficulty, I mean I got all the achievements and got the true ending, I beat it with all weapons and I persevered in the face of absolute bulls*it the game dishes out at you.  That still doesn't mean that it is an easy game by any stretch of the imagination, and I'm not particularly asking for the game to become a walk in the park.  But seriously, and I say this with a lot of respect for the game you made: please stop being afraid to give more power to the player, let us feel comfortable with our choices.  Let me have fun.

To the developers: If you read all of this and are still confused about what I'm talking about, I'd be willing to discuss it further.  But I'm not sure how much help that would be if your vision for the game is already set in stone.  If a future patch revises the mods and gameplay, I'll take a look at it again.

只玩了联机，不知道单人是不是数值体验不一样
Roguelite不应该把完整的体验放在全局升级里，在一开始游戏的时候玩家根本没有和怪物匹配的强度，那个小剑的攻击范围又近伤害又低，一套平a5-6下连个小怪都砍不死，联机下画面信息又杂乱，被打一下要掉8-10的血，几下就死了，也没什么回血手段。
还有起手2个房间啥都没有就拿点钱，不懂这种房间设置的意义是什么，Rogue就应该削弱玩家的初期重复体验，你要是觉得玩家可能会去刷初始，就加一些获得初始内容的限制，就像杀戮尖塔那样。
lite的全局升级应该偏重于机制的增减，比如增加特别的房间、机制、解锁更多的物品，像死亡细胞那样。
还有闪避不能取消攻击后摇就算了，不能打断当前攻击指令是什么意思，我还得先停止攻击才能闪避，这是什么格斗游戏么。最好的战斗方式竟然是怂着打，rouge游戏我的血量难道不是资源么，激进的战斗方式没有任何收益。
以及联机体验并不好，朋友老掉线。

149981191.review:
I wish Steam had a middle-thumbs option because that's what I'd give this. With friends it's a great time for 15-20 hours, and you'll definitely get your money's worth. I played pre- and post-release and not much changed between, it's missing some polish for what would make it feel like a finished product.

In short: It feels like the devs started out with a great foundation and potential, then lost interest partway through and just pushed to get the game out. Just about every single thing about Ember Knights shows good promise, then falls flat.

Gameplay: 
-- Core gameplay is fun enough, but as other people have mentioned, the runs all end up feeling the same despite it being a roguelite. There's not enough diversity of powers, synergies, enemies or zones, and it's a set linear path with a set pattern for rooms, bosses, etc., which makes the endless mode extra unappealing, and the game relies on you wanting to play the endless mode.
-- Challenge is middling for a roguelite, with difficulty spikes lategame. Replayability is very low in its current state.
-- Later stages are so visually overstimulating it detracts from the experience, with large enemies rolling up the sides of the screen that you can't kill but shoot large projectiles as additional obstacles. I have no issue with that, except the enemies overlap and hide regular enemies shooting or jumping at you from underneath. Those are high-damage stages where every hit really counts, so big yikes.

Lore/aesthetics: 
-- The world *looks* like it has cool lore, but only a bare minimum is provided, and so progress through the game visually feels disjointed and the art direction often feels random even if it is nice. 
-- Stage design is meh.
-- There is little story background given for anything going on and about most of the characters and neither does anyone have any personality.

Multiplayer: Bear in mind I played exclusively 4-player.
-- The player character models are similar enough for it to be extremely easy to lose track of who or where you are, especially with a lot of enemies on screen.
-- I have a huge problem with the player info (HP, skills available, armor, icon, etc.) where at least in 4-player, it covers not only a portion of the bottom of the screen, but a portion that overlays gameplay. It goes mostly transparent when any player is behind it, which means you 1) can't reliably see enemies shooting you when it's not transparent, and 2) when it IS transparent, you can barely see what your stats are or if your skills are ready. The fade-in, fade-out of the player info as people pass under it just adds to the overall visual overstimulation and frustrating messiness of 4-player multiplayer.

Edit post-Reforge update: Literally nothing to change to anything of the above. Game is still unbalanced, buggy and unsatisfying. Most new additions didn't change much. :/

149781073.review:
I have enjoyed this game, and i'd want to recommend it, but I just can't really for some very disappointing issues:
This is a rouge-like action game, you travel through maps collecting relics and power ups. I like game-play aspects but this game fails in some crucial areas. Specifically, the replay value falls off quickly. The game takes about 25 minutes to play through start to finish once you've gotten good at it. There are 5 maps with differing rooms, at first they seem detailed but you quickly realize there is little variety in each map. I have seen the same identical rooms populate with the same enemies three times in a row and this sort of thing is pretty common. There is poor balance between the various skills and relics, where some are must haves and others garbage. Each play-through you try to build an optimum strategy with the relics you happen to find, problem is, you only get to pick from a small pool each time and as you unlock more relics on each play through, most of them being less than useful, it actually makes it harder to make a meaningful and cohesive build. The more you unlock the more randomness fights your ability to make useful builds. There are some things that mitigate this, like rerolls, but they are very limited in use. Its a little disappointing because the game has great potential, but my primary issue is the monotonous replay through a very short game with little variety. Enemy variety is poor as well, there about 3 or 4 models per map that come in different colors to represent tougher versions.  For the price of this game I'd expect more, especially comparing it to other games in this genre, this one falls short. Would be fun to play with friends if you can get it on sale, just don't expect it to hold your interest for long.

4/12 Update:
Decided I'd update my review and change it to recommend. I enjoy this game, its not perfect but it is pretty fun especially with friends. They've added some QoL improvements and some other good updates, however the game still falls short in many areas as mentioned in my earlier review, such as the lack of variety in enemies or stages and poor balance with some skills and such. All said, its a decent party game. Better if you can get it on sale.

149759359.review:
Nothing too impressive, a very solid rogue-like dungeon crawler to play with friends. If co-op wasn't a thing, this game would probs fall into obscurity, the co-op element really serves it.

Screen becomes too chaotic at 3/4 players, which adds to the fun but after a while it's pretty obvious that you're never gonna finish the game (if you're playing at 1 screen).

Very satisfying to build combos,the simple relics that combine and create powerful interactions is the core of this type of gameplay and it's very well executed.

Theme-wise the devs definitely had some plans, but it falls a little bit flat. Flashy executions but it feels more of a proof-of-concept rather than a full thematic exploration. That's fine tho, the game's main purpose is the combat, but you always appreciate more thought going into the themes/vibes, at least on my end.

Can recommend it at full price, given that you can do local co-op. Definitely worth a buy at discounts.

148917766.review:
[i][url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/noPROblemscommunity]no.PROblems* [/url] presenta...[/i]
[h1]ASCUAS Y FUEGO ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐[/h1] 
[b]✅ El mejor top-down beat'em up de steam
✅ Precioso, redondo y divertidisimo
✅ Muchisimas builds en cada partida…
❌…aunque le falta algo mas de contenido
❌ Queremos mas niveles y updates
[/b]

Que DOOM TURTLE inicie su andadura en Steam con este petardazo de juego, es impresionante. De verdad, lo que esta gente ha parido, a nivel cooperativo, del reto que plantea a los jugadores y el mimo que destila por cada pixel, lo convierte en un referente dentro de este género, como en su dia fue DEAD CELLS en los metroid-vania.

Sobre la historia que sirve de excusa hay poco que comentar, un malo quiere acabar con el “fuego” de la vida, y nosotros deberemos vencerlo, gracias a conseguir ascuas en cada una de las incursiones. Los personajes que nos ayudarán en nuestra aventura tienen un diseño especial, todo lo contrario que el malo final, el cual se ve algo genérico. De todos modos, aquí lo importante es la jugabilidad, y de esta hay toneladas.

Aunque por momento, la cantidad de daño que recibimos de los enemigos, es algo elevada, y castiga muchos los errores, la cantidad de habilidades y mecánicas a nuestra disposición igualan bastante el combate. Además, según vas desbloqueando “habilidades” se amplia muchísimo la variedad de builds, con distintos poderes /estados y beneficios con los que podemos enfrentarnos a los enemigos. Estos, aunque tienen bastante variedad, pecan de lo mismo que el juego, les falta algo de “aleatoriedad, me explico; si el juego tuviera mas armas, poderes y enemigos que pudieran entre-mezclarse, no seria tan lineal como acaba resultando. No es un problema enorme, pero te queda el mal sabor de boca con la poca profundidad que tiene en este aspecto.

De una u otra manera, al igual que hace años recomendaba a boca llena el DEAD CELLS,  hoy puedo trasladar esos comentarios a esta obra. De lo mas divertido actualmente en el catalogo de steam, valido para todo la familia, y de esos juegos que te hacen latir el corazoncito mas fuerte.

148843735.review:
Another fun rogue like/lite with multiplayer. Progress you character permanently by getting ash/embers from killing bosses and temporarily by getting stat orbs during your run.

Game currently has 6 worlds to beat (you start off with 5, unlock 6th later) and harder difficulties with modifiers that you unlock later on after beating world 5. Game has endless mode as well for those that want it.

Currently, however the game has no way to save you runs. So if your tight for time then chances are you might want to avoid this game for now (the devs are thinking about adding a save feature but have have to reach a final decide on the topic). Currently though, the game can be beaten in an hour or so (or less if your skilled/got the proper set up, my first world 5 win i did in 44 mins roughly) so its not too big of a deal if you got at least 2h of free time id say.

The game is also very fast paced and rewards quickness. Shortly after beating the first few worlds you will unlock "aid packages" that you can get after killing bosses if you manage to get to it before a set time. First world you need to beat in under 7 mins to get the aid package and so on. It may sound tuff, but it is doable.

All keys are rebindable, options to disable screen shake, turn on full screen, ect. And i must say, although the game seems hectic at parts, its pretty lenient when it comes to dodging/invincibility frames.

Now, as for price, i will admit, it is a bit much for how fast the game can be beaten, but id say its worth it if your into the genre. Otherwise, it might be best to wait for a sale.

147829876.review:
A solid roguelike that shines while playing with friends. I wouldn't say it's the most memorable game that'll stick with you for ages, but it's definitely very engaging for your time with it.

The artistic quality is strong. The designs of the knights all have a lot of visual clarity and the animations match the smooth gameplay. Music is pretty great and fits the action. The ability to choose and unlock your knight's aesthetics is greatly appreciated (who doesn't love a bit of customization?)

The gameplay feels smooth paced, you feel very mobile, and naturally as you progress you start to feel more powerful. The difficulty feels challenging but fair, you're not dealing with any stupid one-shots unless you've chosen to ramp up the damage (endgame feature) and go into endless mode.

The story is weak, but is weak enough it's pretty clear it's really just a device to carry you through the setting, so it doesn't really leave you feeling disappointed.

The only real critique I have is that the different weapons don't feel equally viable. The game definitely favors ranged combat and kiting, making the bow, staff, and to a lesser extent the star feel infinitely superior. While damage doesn't feel unfair, it is rather significant and healing is very limited. Putting yourself in melee range involves being point blank with the melee attacks that most enemies use to hurt you.

The artifacts can offer you more persistent healing, but they rather quickly reach a cap. This means you can get enough healing for sustaining yourself through a single run, but your healing will quickly fall off in comparison to enemy damage as you pursue endless mode.

Artifacts and power up gems affect all weapons equally, meaning your bow will be doing just as much damage, applying the same status effects, and attacking just as fast as your sword. It feels like there's virtually no incentive to use the melee weapons for this reason.

Despite the issues with the balance between the weapons, the artifacts do feel very balanced, with most builds feeling equally viable. Healing feels like a must, but other than that, a stun build, a burn build, a poison build, etc, all feel pretty on par with each other and can successfully carry you through a run.

Would recommend for if you're looking for a roguelike you can sink into for a bit and play with your buds.

147787743.review:
I was really surprised. I'd never heard of it and came across in a search of co-op games and I figured I'd jump in and find a half-baked janky mechanical mess. I was wrong; Doom Turtle knocked it out of the park. I've gone through a little more than half of the game (as far as I can tell) and the mechanics are really solid. 

There's a nice diversity between all of the weapons, skills, and relics. I don't feel like new relics weighed down the RNG pool. Both the pacing and the combat feel great, even with the RNG I haven't felt like it screwed over my runs in any meaningful way; not to say the game isn't challenging, because it absolutely is. 

If you liked Enter the Gungeon or Dead Cells, you'll love this. Plus, it's multiplayer!

My advice for new players: 
- Prioritize getting Embers early on.
- Become a dodge master. It'll save your life.
- Use your skills. If you're not using your skills, you're shorting yourself a victory.
- Start looking for synergies between your skills and relics and start building your runs around them.
- Don't be afraid to respec at the tree. It's always free.

It should be more AOE,  high frequent melee attacks, maybe mirror clones, lasers, teleport,etc. If you guys want to add mini bosses, maybe just put it in previous levels but a lot stronger than now.

146944210.review:
Hello guys just another ember knight here...

I usually play action rogue lite like this with my wife and another couple friends, local coop. We played Lost Castle A LOT and it was very fun. Since we usually play once a weekend, most of us are drunk and half of us are non gamers, we played Lost Castle for like a year or so.

I was hoping ember knights to be our long waited replacement for Lost Castle, and it seems worthy since the game play is indeed fun and fast paced. However, here are some suggestions I'd like to see in order to have a smothier "party" play style:

1. Add a softer revival mechanic: even though the game is fast paced, the down time is huge when people die. On my runs with friends they were dead 3/4 of the world while I was just single playing the game. Things get even worse since dead people wont get any upgrades, thus making it harder when they revive. Also dead people just get bored, which is worse since the game is so exciting. The suggestion here is just let people revive using mechanics like pressing buttons on other dead embers or so. If you are worried about making the game easier, just add a dificult setting or something.

2. Playing the game in group makes the game harder on bosses: It seems that some mechanics on bosses are meant for single player not multiplayer, I mean, when the first boss spawns the lightning bolts, I'm very able to dodge them when alone but things get totally out of controll if there is someone else. The bolts will drop on both of us making the dodge space smaller, I never got to try it when there where more than 2 people alive, but I bet it would be impossible to doge or very hard at least. Here I suggest that the monster IA just target one of the players at random so the patterns are more predictable. Making changes to the ressurect mechanic would make this easier to handle as well.

3. Allow more ember color customizations or even "gender" choice. It seems cosmetic, but people, specially my wife and her sister, really take time choosing their looks. This gets also worse when people die because the color of their ember seems to change when they revive.

That's all, thanks for the great game. I do recomend it for more skilled players, it is just not "easy" enough to be played as a party casual game.

Great roguelite, but you wont play it for too long. 

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

+ crisp pixel art style

+ great controls

+ skill based combat

+ lots of various builds

+ local and online coop

+ cool boss and mini-boss fights

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

146818491.review:
Ember Knights is a rogue-lite game that you can play with up to 4 players online or locally. I already have 20+ hours on it in less than a week, and I'd rate it an 8.5/10.

[h3] Content: [/h3]
There are 6 different weapons, all of which are equally unique in their playstyles. You can select up to 3 (out of 9) weapon modifications unique to that weapon, which adds even more variation to the weapons you can use. There are 80+ relics to choose from with synergies and themes, so the builds can vary heavily. There are around 20 skills in the game that you must find in your runs, and you can equip up to 2 of them. There are 5 stats, which include HP, attack damage, skill damage, crit rate, and speed. The Ember Tree is like a rune system where you can select perks for your runs (heal after clearing a room, bonus damage against bosses, etc.). There are a total of 5 worlds with unique enemies and bosses. You can choose to modify the difficulty of the game with 3 difficulties (easy, normal, and hard) and modifiers (bonus enemy HP, bonus enemy spawn, etc.).

[h3] Gameplay: [/h3]
Overall, the gameplay is smooth, and the movement feels fluid. Players can roll, which allows you to cross gaps in terrain and grants i-frames. When using attacks or skills, there is a mechanic called "perfect" casting that grants bonuses to your attacks or skills. Perfects require good timing, and some relics are tied to the perfect mechanic. During runs, players can choose between different rooms such as stat rooms, skill rooms, shops, bonus gold, or bonus ember, which allows for more freedom of choice.

[h3] Multiplayer: [/h3]
The netcode is insanely good. I have played online with poor internet and still had seamless gameplay as a server and client. Loot is multiplied by the number of players, so there is no need to fight over loot. Players can use the same weapon as each other as well. Player and outfit colors can be changed to personalize your character and distinguish yourself in multiplayer lobbies; these are purely cosmetic. The difficulty is amplified based on the number of players there are, and you can further increase the game's difficulty by modifying the run prior to starting. The progress gained from multiplayer is only saved for the host.

[h3] Needed Improvements: [/h3]
Though this game is good, it is far from perfect. There are only 5 worlds (including the final boss world) in each run, and they are always encountered in the same exact order. It would be nice if they added more variety or mixed up the maps. I think having at least 3 varieties for each non-final boss world would fix the much-needed depth this game lacks. Rogue-likes rely heavily on their replayability, and the lack of world diversity really hurts that aspect of this game. This is the reason for the -1.5 points in my rating. It is currently version 1.1, so I hope to see more worlds in the future!

146604132.review:
This is a top-down, hack-and-slash action game very much in the vein of Hades.  It's very clear that the developers were heavily influenced by Hades, but there is enough different here to make it very very much worth playing.  Besides the different weapons and the various upgrades that they can have equipped, in each run, you can hold up to two skills at a time.  Skills are abilities that you can trigger at any time at the press of a button, and will have offensive and/or defensive abilities.  These are on a cool-down, but the way the cool-down works is interesting; instead of waiting a certain amount of time, it's a certain number of hits with your weapon you must make in order to refill the cool-down.  It rewards aggression and quick reflexes, it's a lot of fun.

The story is extremely simple, to the point where it almost doesn't exist, so don't expect Hades-level dialogue, but I do think that, when the combat really clicks, it is about as good as the combat of Hades.  My one caveat about the game play is that it is kind of easy.  I don't think it's TOO easy, especially considering that you have to do a run with a lot of points in this game's version of pact of punishment, but it is definitely on the easy side.

Another way in which I wish this took more from Hades is the quantity of content.  Not that they have to have the same amount of content that Hades did, that's a ridiculous standard to hold anybody to.  However, once you complete the game, there's pretty much nothing left to do.  I've 100% the game with the exception of a handful of achievements, and I only have 24.5 hours total in the game.  Considering this game's price point it's still worth it, but be aware that's it kind of short.

146198510.review:
My friends and I have had a blast playing this game since very early on and with every change we kept coming back for more. Every update has been great and I am looking forward to the changes they have coming with version 1.1 and on.

Ember Knights is well balanced and get's easier as you gain more unlocks (as you should), but it keeps its replay value after you unlock the difficulty modifier. There are so many options for different builds that you will likely beat the game many times before you can test out every build. I highly encourage you to test out different, weapon perks, relics, and abilities because you can get some truly potent combinations going.

The only advice I would offer for newer players is to explore and get those CC abilities!

Highly recommended!

I started playing with 2 friends, we got pretty far but didn't quite beat Praxis. Then I played solo for a while and got really good at the game and found a build I really liked. Eventually I teamed back up with my friends and we got the true ending on Doom difficulty! 

every part about 100%'ing the game felt good, and I hope this studio puts out more stuff like this!

145725640.review:
It's fun, but repetitive. 

There's a big spike in difficulty, where bosses go from rogue-like to being a bullet hell. Basically act 3. It's so diffrerent from the first 2 acts, which I liked, that it felt like i was now playing a different game. I think it was a bad direction to go with it. This bullet hell change, large arenas where bosses run off screen, it doesn't work well with local co-op. It actually makes it better that one of your teammates dies, so it's not requiring you to fight over the camera. Act 1 is the sweat spot, but I don't think that design noticed that, since the arena's got bigger, while the camera stays zoomed in.(If the camera zoomed WAAAAY out to compensate for bosses running across the map, that would really help with this specific problem) 

The item pool is small... a game like this, for repeat runs, you need a large pool of items, where each run will feel unique. Also, the items that "are" there aren't all equal. Most items are inferior to just building a "cooldown-focused, summons, and all damage does poison damage" build. With what little options I have, I'm already stuck doing just that one build. 

It's not a bad game, but a missed opportunity. After playing it 2 times with a friend, we lost interest because of the issues i listed above.

Мне понравилась игра, хорошая (местами бесила, но хорошая). Много очень положительных отзывов, почитайте о них в других рекомендациях. А я поставлю свой дизлайк за одного конкретного, невероятно дисбалансного моба, изза которого мой пердак горел как красная гавань в огне Дейнерис, после очередной череды смертей от которого я оказался здесь.

И это не босс, не мини босс. Это просто моб, Колотун версии чемпион из мира Анвилль. Я был недоволен, но принял это, когда впервые, несколько раз на высоком уровне сложности попал к нему. Я казалось нашел решение борьбы с ним, а когда вновь и вновь не мог повторить задумался. Я пришел к нему в последний раз в бесконечном режиме, с кучей вкаченых перков, со всевозможными защитами, бафами и дебафами. Все процентные статы были выше 250%, некоторые выше 400, я переваривал как хлеб все на своем пути, боссов, толпы врагов, праксиса. Но это х***я, снесла меня ровно один в один, как она это делала когда я был слаб. Я прошел всю игру, собрал все ачивки. Очень доволен проведенным временем. И очень недоволен этим мобом. Дисбаланс этой хрени черезмерно высок.

П.С. В игре вообще слишком много атак разных мобов и боссов которые никак не доджатся. Создатели, мое вам недовльство .!.

У меня все. А игру покупайте. Классная

145504160.review:
2023.9.2
       各位买之前，建议先认真看看它的相关游玩视频。
       这个不推荐是以单人玩家的身份给出的，有朋友一起的话会很好玩。
       下面说一下游玩感受：这游戏近战有剑、锤、镰刀，半远程有回旋镖和法杖，纯远程武器弓箭，武器各自有强化（但强化开启好像要打赢第四个世界的boss，而且是两次），强化要黑色的余烬（打特殊房间掉落，一般2-3个），此外天赋树（蓝色余烬强化，感觉有用但不多），商店（好像是打过第四世界才有，物品也是蓝色余烬购买）。闪避的无敌挺长的。角色属性：血量，力量，暴击，技能伤害倍率，移速（它翻译是这么写的，但实际就不知道了，翻译属实一言难尽），
      房间： 圣物房（翻译叫圣物转换。。圣物应该是是无上限的），技能房（角色只有两个槽，可调换可调位），属性房（有两种，随机属性然后三选一，或者是给单一属性的房间），活祭（要商店买空瓶子触发剧情才开启，丢不要的吐个随机出来，技能和圣物都行），余烬房（蓝色和黑色，黑色要打完小boss在右上角找到马文对话，再打一次找回他的手臂，回基地对话才出来），温泉房（回血的），还有模仿大师（经典三个宝箱狂换位置猜真货在哪，彩蛋要炸弹技能，炸掉它的留声机），商店（彩蛋是拆他的招牌），基本挺完善的就不说，但地图，没有，回头路，没有，嗯，看个人吧，反正我不太适应
1.近战武器真的是在坐牢。本身第一世界的小怪和boss还好说，蜘蛛，刀虫之类的在普通难度下还能打（虽然我真的想杀了那个喷毒液圈的怪的🐎，nmd居然能瞬间转火）；第二个世界就折磨了，地图狭窄，冲锋的战士加上冰柱子和法师，对近战操作真的折磨，哦还有容易被忽视但擅长关键枪的弓箭手，但也不是不能打（锤子例外，这东西救不了）；第三世界，是近战最后的爽地，狼人，光条袍（你看到就知道为啥这样称呼了），骷髅和老鼠，小怪攻击前摇长，范围也不算大（建议最终boss设置在这）；第四个世界那就完了，光剑哥，电网（有些房间的电网是在锤子和剑打不掉的点），以及会闪烁的无🐎机器，自此我归顺了弓箭神教，后面就再没用过近战了。
2.圣物的组合效果不够“放肆”。组合难凑、效果不强，且基本没有特别适合近战武器的效果（开了所有圣物也没找到近战专用强化），没有攻速和直接的属性强化，基本全是效果词条组合（燃烧、毒、眩晕），目前有成长性的藏品就两个每击杀4个敌人加力量和击杀一定敌人加技能伤害（翻译真的搞好点啊，看不懂啊），但这两个的掉率嘛。。。（快打最终boss才出来，搞事是吧）。能组出来的不算多，且考虑到回血手段只有暴击治疗组合、商店血瓶和地图掉落食材（食材可加工且有彩蛋，要武器有燃烧效果），暴击治疗加弓箭在强度上一骑绝尘（希望后续更新好一点）。
       综上，远程武器不受折磨，圣物组出来爽感不够，整体局内局外养成长、不连贯，没特色，在这框架下武器没办法发挥应有的设计强度（这就不得不提一下Dungreed，是真的好玩，就是基本不更新，艹），当前￥76.00价格下，单人玩家请谨慎考虑入库。（最后骂一句，玛德这sb辅助瞄准P用没有）

       惊了，Dungreed有大更新了，我在这多整两句能再多更新几次嘛

145461420.review:
[h1] Вместе ярче) [/h1]
Скажу сразу – игра хороший кооперативный рогалик, но есть много, но…

Сюжет: злое зло украло жизнь из дерева и оставшиеся (угольки?) – наши герои. Доброе добро должно уничтожить зло. Конец

Контента в игре очень мало: 17 навыков, половина из которых 8 – обычные атаки с разными стихийными элементами, 2 – ближний бой, граната, петы, баллиста, 2 разных спелла на заморозку, 1 – отбрасывание и кубик рандома повышения статов на комнату. Мало 

Миров всего 5, но ковыряться в них можно достаточно долго (по 5 – 7 мин на 1). В каждой локе есть 1 мини-босс и 1 босс (по несколько цветовых версий и упор в какие-то атаки у каждого свои, усложняются в Сложном Режиме). Все так или иначе +- уникальны и с уникальными поведениями. Но всё равно мало разнообразия

Много друг с другом стакающихся реликвий, билды сами собой собераются. В основном на стихиях (обморожение, ожог, отравление, молнии), а также ошеломление, возрождение, доспехи, использование навыка – действие, лечение

С друзьями бегать весело, но почти нет никакого взаимодействия, нет синергий, если вы с друзьями выбираете разные классы, нет уникальных совместных приёмов

В игре есть также 6 классов (оружия), отличные друг от друга – меч, лук, посох, молот, сюрикен, коса. Меч и молот – тупая атака напролом, посох и сюрикен – средняя дистанция, лук – дальняя дистанция и коса ближняя + дальняя (дающая дебафф) атака. Оружия можно прокачивать (2 раза пройти 4 локу), обладает выбором билда (3 ветви по 3 улучшения – выбор 1 в каждой ветке) оружия

Статы: хп/урон/урон от навыков/крит/скорость – очень креативно) 

После прохождения 5 локаций можно выйти на Новую Игру + (Сложный Режим), где можно будет выбирать себе усложнения и стартовый эквип (ресы древа) и выйти на настоящую концовку. При определённом количестве поинтов усложнений можно выйти на настоящего финального босса игры (Праксис на Харде) 

Идеальная игра: пройти игру + прокачать дерево/оружие/навыки/улучшения + открыть секреты/скины и пройти игру на Сложном режиме + уничтожить всех мобов и боссов. Не сложно, но фармить понадобиться

ИТОГ: играбельно и даже рекомендую. Однако контента действительно кроха для рогалика, кооператив не раскрыт, билды скучные, из 6 оружия понравилось только 3 – меч, лук и коса. Остальное такое себе. На пару вечерков неплохо, подойдёт для тусовок с друзьями, но не больше.

Played with friends via steam Remote Play and it's worked well and we've been having fun. However, there significant balance issues - namely the game is skewed heavily in favor of the bow with some form of crit build.
