142538221.review:
It's rare for a game to capture both the magnificence of solitude and the desire to share those memorable moments with others. The game I'm speaking about today is one of these rare cases that shine with their careful design and engaging gameplay. It's a piece of work that's just as captivating to experience solo as it would be to share with friends.

From the get-go, the solo experience plunges you into a fantastic adventure, filled with challenges, mysteries, and astonishing encounters. The graphics are stunning, the scenery breathtaking, each detail finely crafted to create an immersive atmosphere.

Exploring this vast world is a thrilling adventure, with secrets hidden away that push you to delve deeper. The gameplay is smooth, the controls intuitive, and the balance between difficulty and progression is perfectly mastered.

But beyond the technical aspect, it's the feeling of solitude that makes this game so special. It's not a burdensome solitude, but rather a form of freedom, an opportunity to lose oneself in a fantastical universe. It's in this world that we realize how one can be both happy and sad, satisfied and unsatisfied, all while being alone.

However, despite all this splendor and rich emotions, a shadow looms over my gaming experience. It's the absence of a friend to share this adventure with. This game is a work of art that deserves to be experienced by two, to be shared and discussed. The prospect of living this epic adventure alone saddens me, because I know the joy of discovery would be doubled if it were shared.

Each victory, each discovery, each moment of pure wonder is tinged with a hint of melancholy. Because every time I achieve a feat or unlock a new world, I turn to share my joy, and instead, I find emptiness.

In the end, this game is a treasure, a masterpiece that I highly recommend. It's perfect for solo players, but it's also a beautiful world that would benefit from being shared. If only my friend understood how much the experience could be enriched by their presence...

So yes, I'm playing this game all alone and it's really good. But every victory is also a reminder of the solitude. It's a game for two, played by one.

EDIT : Really hope for a DLC in the future. LOVE this game.

6. From the drop down menu select "Proton 7.0-6"
7. After that installs, reboot your Steam Deck and launch the game


Please let us know if that works!

142523873.review:
Great action rogue-lite.  Snappy combat, dodge roll with invincibility frames, nice selection of weapons with lots of abilities to unlock between runs.  Weapons can also be modded for more variety.  Mini-bosses have several variants which are randomly selected each run, making the run itself more varied.

The game plays very similarly to Hades, but with a much cuter art style and Co-op!  Couch coop is quite fun, as is online co-op.  The devs keep updating it with new weapons and new worlds, so every time it gets updated I can jump back in and play more.  

I do wish I could collect Ash (weapon modding currency) when I already have everything unlocked.  Then I'd be able to instantly unlock new weapon mods when they get added.  However I get that it's probably done this way on purpose so when new weapons are released, it's incentive to play new runs to unlock all the mods for the new weapon.

Otherwise, great game.  Runs feel varied enough to keep it fresh with a large selection of abilities and relics, and once you beat the game you can up the difficulty if you wish.  If you like roguelites and the art style, give this one a chance.

142493127.review:
Ember Knights is a wonderful rogue-lite that offers a satisfying gameplay loop, a vibrant art style, and a co-op feature that makes it even more fun to play with friends. I have been playing this game with my partner for over 50 hours, and we are still enjoying every run. The game has a lot of variety and replay value, thanks to the different weapons, skills, relics, and enemies that you can encounter. The game also has a compelling story and lore, and we are looking forward to more content coming out for this game.

The only negative criticism I have is that the maps get too big for screen sharing towards the end and boss fights. This makes it hard to coordinate and see what is going on. So, I had to buy my girlfriend a copy of the game on her Steam account so that we weren't screen bounded. This was a minor inconvenience, but it was worth it to experience the game in its full glory.

Overall, I highly recommend Ember Knights to anyone who loves action rogue-lites, pixel graphics, and co-op games. It is a brilliant throwback to the old arcade games brought to the future with its interesting gameplay and world design. It just keeps getting better and much more diverse in options with each new run, and it’ll definitely keep you coming back for more.

142491883.review:
Disclaimer: I haven't beaten a run in v1.0 yet, but i did multiple in v0.9. I cannot comment on the endgame just yet.

Very fun roguelite with lots of content and viable builds. It's very fast-paced and responsive and takes lots of inspiration from other great games in the genre. The combat is simple yet skilful and It's very fun co-op. It introduces new content at a good pace to keep everything feeling fresh while allowing the player to get a good grasp of the fundamentals without getting overwhelmed. 

If I were to compare it to any games, it would be Hades and a bit of Castle Crashers. If you liked both of those, you'll probably enjoy this.

142490821.review:
I finished the game, got 100% and this is my review after doing so.

Edit:
1) They have not changed the balancing at all, critical heal is still god tier in comparison to any other form of build
 2) I hate the way they dealt with achievements. They added new ones for the newest update and they are not even relevant at all. "hit X times perfectly with a weapon", "finish a run on X difficulty with X weapon", etc. All of these could have been included in the original release, but instead they decided to add them later on to screw off people and force them to invest more hours into this title.


First off: the game starts weak, really weak.
A) You have a row of relics which are fine on their own. But there is no real build diversity at this point of the game.
B) Difficulty of enemies seems a bit off. Certain enemies in Area 2 feel stronger than on Area 3 and even 4. But that's only till you learn their patterns. Which is quite normal for this kind of game/genre.
C) Many game mechanics are locked behind certain NPC you encounter at certain stages. It should take you 2 runs to area 4 to unlock most facilities.

Once you are done with that... the real gameplay starts. It's enjoyable.

If you played Hades you will see a few similarities.

Your "main" weapon is selected in the HUB. You can Upgrade the weapon later on and even select different Augments for it. I believe they were done quite good.

You can find Spells during your run, you can have 2 at once on you. I enjoy the spell design but I would like to see way more variety.

A run takes around 25~40 minutes depending on how well you do. If you do really well you can lower your time even more but that's more of an exception. It saves most changes nearly instantly but you can not take a break and return to a previous run, it counts as an fail once you exit the game.

Enemy design is quite good. Boss design is fine, there are some variants which are a bit "too strong" but nothing impossible to beat, Dev's did a good job here.

Areas? I would wish for more areas and room designs. It's the only point I have an issue with.


Would  I recommend this game? Yes, I do. I would think a sweet spot would be 15€ mark. I would have zero regrets buying it at this price point. 20€ is quite fair, too.

142442007.review:
I've beat this game multiple times on the hardest difficulty with various builds that I came up with. Unfortunately, the developers thought that it was a good idea to force players to adopt weapon/skill synergies by making fake-RNG rerolls that repeat the options they want you to use (they admitted to this in the Discord). This means that the game is discouraging you from being creative with builds and finding your own way. This is completely against the spirit of a roguelike/roguelite game and stuff like this is why I'm so hesitant to play new rogue games (some developers are so stubborn); I find it to be a very disingenuous approach to developing a game for this genre.

If they changed this (or at least started listening to the general playerbase) then I would gladly play again. In a roguelike, I don't care if I get bad rolls if there is real RNG (to me that is fair), but if the game is actively working against me (in my opinion) and pretending to use RNG or trying to "lean the RNG a little more in [my] favor" and I get consistently bad rolls because of this, then it doesn't feel very fun to me. The core gameplay, art, and different abilities are great, but the fake RNG is a massive turn off for me personally. I've had the same relics/skills appear on the 1, 3, and 5 rerolls multiple times. When there are 17 skills, this shouldn't be happening when there are only 2 skill options per roll. I know some people won't agree, but that's my opinion on it.

I also think that the developers listened to player feedback very little during the early access period and pretty much just did what they felt like doing from the beginning. What is the point of doing early access if you aren't going to at least consider feedback (especially when it's feedback that is voiced by a large majority of players, such as adding a 'save and quit' feature for endless runs).

142392629.review:
So I've been playing Ember Knight for about a month before the 1.0 release and I just completed the 1.0 content.

I certainly love this game and while I have definitely enjoyed my initial experience, the 1.0 release is a bit of a disappointment.

I do want to make it clear that I like this game and if you're a new player, there is a lot to enjoy if you like games like Hades or Binding of Isaac

While this review might contain some 1.0 release specific critiques, I do have some other issues that could use some improvements

Here are some 1.0 specific issues:
- No new relics, no new skills. Only 1 new weapon which isn't all that different from some of the other "fast-hitting" melee type weapon

- Also the new weapon's hitbox is little janky. I would swing at an object right in front of me but the hit doesn't register in certain situations.

- The final level design is very basic and feels tacked on/rushed. It's just couple rooms before the final boss. No items, no shops. I think the last couple normal fights should still offer rewards.

- Some of the boss variants do not feel difficult but rather cheap. There are some attacks that immobilize you and then there is a subsequent attack coming right afterwards. This means that if you get hit by the first one, there is absolutely no way of mitigating the subsequent damage because you can't move, attack or use your skills. This feels weird because with 1.0 patch, freezing was nerfed where players can no longer perma-freeze the enemies but the enemies can to an extent while dishing out heavy damage.

- My biggest gripe with the 1.0 release and the final boss content is that if you want to get the true ending, you have to play at difficulty "Doom." While the game isn't impossible to beat at this level  if you have everything unlocked, I have absolutely no clue why the developers decided to do this. This is literally gate-keeping main content of the game to a pretty extreme level. Just have an achievement for beating the game at the highest difficulty, don't keep the main content of the game and the ending away from the players with this BS. SPOILDER ALERT: [spoiler]The true final boss isn't even that difficult. Some minibosses or normal enemies are tougher[/spoiler]

Now here are some general non 1.0 related issues:
- While there are variety of different types of weapons, lot of them play similarly. Especially the melee weapons with the exception of the hammer. All of the weapons have upgrades and different movesets but they are very underwhelming to use and not very build defining. I think the weapon upgrades and alt-fire needs some rework or have relics that focus on them to make them useful

- Not enough relics throughout your run. Unless you're playing in endless mode and looping through the game several times, you're not going to find that many relics to really have a crazy wacky build unless you very lucky and hit every single relic you need. On average, I found myself finding about 10-13 relics per run. I think one of the biggest appeal of roguelike games like this is the amount of possibly gambreaking OP builds you can try. However because the game is so stingy with the relics, the game is already over by the time you feel like your build is just starting to come together. Offering more relic rooms or at least giving us the option of rerolling the next room (like in Hades) would make this so much better. Relics are what makes the game like this fun.

142355285.review:
Hades is the core inspiration for the formula, but they've by no means cloned it. This is an extremely charming and minimalist approach to the genre and it does it without a single flaw in design. The single player and co-op play is pristine. It's very fun, there's a lot of variance in the runs, there's many ways to build characters and the relic interactions can become very spicy. Calling it "Hades meets Castle Crashers" isn't an inaccurate comparison.

The only two issues I have right now is that, first, the colorblind support is poor; red warning AoE markers are low contrast, thin, and don't last long so if you miss the initial flash of the attack, you are going to have a very hard time if you're red-green colorblind. It doesn't ruin the experience but it's definitely a frustration.

Second, I can't take local players into online games with me. There may be intentional reasons for this, but it made it hard to play with friends when I had either my sibling with me, or someone from Remote Play Together, and we wanted to join my other friends online. This isn't a massive flaw, but it was a disappointment.

It's worth noting those are my ONLY two disappointments I experienced in my 7 hours of playing. This game has clear polish, and plenty of content to fill it in. Nothing feels empty, and the game is fast paced enough that you see a large variety of the content quickly so it doesn't feel stale or slow. The rate you unlock things seems respectably fast.

This may in turn make the "end game" arrive too soon and the content drought might be real, but for the moment? I don't care. It's too much fun.

142334958.review:
I purchased this game in early access and have enjoyed the full extent of the development process. I waited with mounting anticipation for the 1.0 release and subsequent content drop, unfortunately the 1.0 patch is plagued with many of the issues that had been resolved in previous patches. This leads me to believe that the build of the game that has been released for 1.0 is a prior test build that wasn't subject to the various changes that happened in the time leading up to 1.0. 

The game was very tightly controlled and well programmed. There are several weapons for the user to experiment with and customize to their play style. The upgrades are balanced and provide wonderful synergistic effects. The Co-op is a welcome addition. Though I play solo for most of my runs, this has the potential to be one of the greats in the Action Roguelike/Roguelite genres, taking its place along gems like Enter The Gungeon, Nuclear Throne, Binding of Isaac, and Hades. 

It is unfortunate that the 1.0 is experiencing issues, but I'm sure that the team will get it right eventually. 

Presently the enemies will attack through the user's guard, they launch attacks even though they are stunned, the dodge won't protect from most AOE attacks and frequently the user's attacks are ignored as the enemies accumulate damage after their own attacks land. Here's hoping they'll fix the bugs and get back to excellence.

Although I'd like to wholeheartedly recommend the experience, in its present state its a frustrating and stressful game that doesn't reward the time you've invested as the unlock-able abilities are not behaving correctly.


Edit: I've played the 1.1 and unfortunately, while it does address the main portion of the bugs the balance on the new content's enemies just isn't there. The rest of the game has a gradual power creep and enemies that can be engaged and eliminated by players using each of the weapon options, but the endgame enemies are only manageable at range or by kiting. The Behemoths, Shades, Grimlins and Arbiters are too strong for the power creep and their projectile attacks consistently make it through my sword slashes when they're meant to be destroyed. I Cranked my Power stat to 97 and it still takes 8-10 hits to eliminate the larger enemies. I hope that things improve and some balance changes occur, but presently the game still needs work.

한글이제 된다!!!!!!! Thank you!!!
플레이시간 7시간에 마지막 스테이지까지 클리어함. 이건 게임이 쉬운게 아니라 음.....뭐라해야하지 막 내가 엄청 게임 잘하는 사람이다를 최대한 어필하지 않고 얘기하자면......엔터더건전 100시간정도 했는데 그냥 이정도면 10시간이면 깰 듯. 예전부터 느꼈지만 난 게임 잘하는 사람이 아니라 게임을 많이 한 사람임. 솔직히 이제 건전같은(회피있는 로그라이크) 로그라이크 게임이면 웬만하면 무리없이 플레이함. 
한줄요약하면 게임 재밌음
단, 특정 스킬이 너무 사기임. 차크람이라는 기술이 있는데 아펠리오스 반월검같은 차크람을 날려 연속타 콤보를 입힌다. 문제는 상대와 나의 거리를 최소한으로 좁히고 쓴다면 폭딜이 나온다. 이걸 이용해서 근접무기인 검, 그러니까 맨처음에 주어지는 검을 이용해서 이 차크람 기술을 응용하면 그냥 미친 폭딜이 나온다. 거기다 차크람은 정말 기본 스킬이어서 초반부터 나온다. 랜덤이긴하지만.....어떤 평가에는 근접혐오겜이다 이런말씀도 하신다. 솔직히말해서 나와 생각이 정말 다르다. 굳이 말하면 이 게임을 본인이 1인플레이로 진행한다면 본인은 무조건....'무조건' 검을 써야한다. 기동성에다 딜도 보장한다. 다른 무기를 써보면 알겠지만 정말 2인이상 코옵을 즐길 경우를 대비한 무기들이다. 검을 안들면 이건 마치 혼자 레이드를 해야하는데 딜러를 안하고 서브딜러로 레이드를 도는 것과 마찬가지다.(물론 게임에서 혼자 레이드를 뛰는 경우가 없지만.....)
근데 겜 진짜 재밌음. 진짜 개재밌음. 개인적으로 1인플레이할 때 무기들의 밸런스를 맞춰줬으면 함.

141708820.review:
- Bonjour à toutes et à tous, voilà près d'un an que j'attend que ce jeu sorte est ont y presque, je n'ai pu me le procurer que depuis peu et après 15h de jeu je suis éblouie par la beauté de ce jeu dans tout les sens du termes un roguelike avec de la coop à 4 du style Hades mais je dis oui, le jeu à une difficulté très bien équilibré et à chaque partie fini ont veut en recommencer une nouvelle que cela soit seul ou à plusieurs le jeu est très addictif et pourtant ce n'est qu'un early access pourtant déjà si prometteur.

- Je suis très confiant concernant le futur de Ember Knights les choix des différents artefacts sont plutôt équilibré simple à comprendre et le fait de pouvoir changer de couleur je trouve cela géniale moi qui suis un adorateur des jeux proposant la possibilité de ce rapprocher de ce qu'on aime le plus comme couleur ou skin, le fait qu'à chaque arme sélectionné le skin design du personnage change rajoute encore un charme que peu de jeu du style ont.

- (Thème/Interface) 5/5 - L'ambiance du point de départ je l'adore il est très chaleureux chaque PNJ donne envie de lui parler et les interfaces sont très simple à comprendre.
Dans la globalité chaque armes est vraiment fun à jouer et il y en aura forcément une qui vous correspondra.

- (Histoire) 4/5 - L'histoire est simple mais le thème nous le fait oublier et ont s'y prend vraiment à vouloir sauvé le petit peuple de ce jeu.

- (Coop) 5/5 - Je le recommande à 1000% surtout si des amies sont prêt à vous suivre dans cette aventure ! Car côté coop avec mes potes on a pas mal rigolé c'est vraiment bien adapté.

- (Graphisme) 5/5 - Je suis ultra fan de ce style de graphisme et tout les puriste de ce style graphique me comprendront.

- (Difficulté) 4.5/5 - Je suis très gourmand de difficultés le début pour ma part était trop simple mais on retrouve vite de la difficulté passer un certains stade c'est similaire à Hades sur ce point et tant mieux.

- (Durée de vie) 4/5 - Ce point dépend énormément de vous, étant habitué à bien plus dure c'est le seul point qui me peine car je l'ai fini vraiment très vite mais j'ai adoré et je veux absolument des mise à jour pour étendre l'aventure. 
Expert des roguelike vous en avez entre 25-35h.
Les joueurs un peu plus casu 45-60h voir bien plus si vous prenez votre temps.

- J’espère avoirs était utile à la communauté et aux développeurs merci d'avoir lu et bonne chance sur Ember Knights.

- Edit : Après avoir fini le jeu plus de 30 fois une fois ce dernier sortie je suis tomber amoureux de ce jeu, c'est une pépite avec un ami ont joue souvent ensemble et ont ne voit pas le temps passé franchement l'un des meilleurs roguelike au monde, merci aux développeurs pour cette merveille et j'attend les futurs mise à jour avec impatience.

140368444.review:
Strangely, this roguelite seemed to fit with me. The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth had interesting interactions with passive picked up in a run, but the damage thresholds against endgame bosses was straight up not fun for me. Enter the Gungeon had too much bullet hell with little else going for it in terms of unlocking items for better chances of winning a run. Wizard of Legend was a cool concept with the wide variety of spells and satisfying spell combos but felt a little too slow for me. Hades was really solid with art, visual effects, and gameplay (which Ember Knights seems to take after very much), but for me, Hades had too much content locked behind completing multiple runs on higher difficulty which discouraged me from experiencing the full potential of each weapon with the gods' powers combined.

Ember Knights pretty much hit all of these points being fast-paced enough, having enough variety of weapons, skills, or relics that influence your combat style each run, and several items and features being accessible after just a few runs. The feeling of the possible synergies experienced in different runs feels like achieving a dream build in The Binding of Isaac where the stuff you get all works together, except you experience these synergies much more frequently. The runs are a fair amount of time with successful runs being 30-35 minutes without the final world/boss which has yet to be included (you are actually encouraged to do each world under a time limit). As of end of Early Access, victory can be achieved very early in this game (I won a run before I had access to the shopkeeper prior to starting a run). For a roguelite, it has a much higher rate of successful runs compared to several others I've played. This can be a major downside for those who are into masocore or difficult games where it takes multiple failures or defeats and many hours before achieving something. And with the way items and features are unlocked, it does not take long before you acquire all there is available in the game. It may leave you wondering if it was worth the $20, even with the difficulty adjuster. These can be major deciding factors for those interested in this game but don't want it to be too easy.

Overall, this game is good for dropping in by yourself or with others to simply have fun with synergies available in the game.

140358845.review: I initially gave this review a positive, as I found it very enjoyable, to the point of putting a few hundred hours into it. I have, however, found myself playing less and less the more updates they add to this game. I am not a fan of the direction that this game is taking, especially with the recent final updates. They inflated the difficulty of the fourth stage by removing the indicators of certain AOE attacks, and Netherra is a visual clutter that I dread playing through every time I reach that point of a 20 minute run. They added the ability for mobs at the brink of death to restore themselves to full HP and receive a buff, an otherwise interesting element if it didn't happen several times a room, every room. After a certain amount of Doom completions, they add more bore to the game than challenge, inflating the enemy hp and restricting the amount of relics you are allotted. The 'Horde' challenge also does not work as a horde system, instead just adding to the amount of total waves you need to complete to advance rooms. Not a fan.

139641920.review:
Le roguelite est un genre qui a vu passer beaucoup de chefs d'oeuvre, et force est de constater qu'Ember Knights trouve très bien sa place. Déja car l'accent mit sur le multi rend le jeu super flex pour lancer une partie entre amis. Mais surtout grace à une early access très bien maitrisée avec des ajouts qui conforte la bonne orientation du jeu. Les patchs mensuels tiennent compte des retours de la commu et intègre très intelligemment ce qui est proposé. Les ajouts récents d'éléments permettent de construire des builds "cassés" ce qui est très fun, et c'est une orientation que j'apprécie beaucoup, que l'on voit de moins en moins dans le genre.
On attend qu'une chose maintenant, le/les derniers biomes , en espérant de solides mécaniques endgame/rejouabilité  pour vraiment amener ses builds et ce gameplay à son max! Cela viendra avec le temps. En tous cas après un an d'early seulement le jeu vaut vraiment le coup!!

139243910.review:
good game. 

ranged weapons are definitely easier to use for each run, but i think this is intentional from the devs to allow for more depth in skills if you want to use melee. 

Melee weapons are certainly much more fun if you get used to patterns and become more familiar with the gameplay. 

Some relics like gaining armor for every dodge is definitely overpowered compared to others, but overall i think most relics are fairly viable depending on which type of dmg u picked up along the run. 

for co-op, i think map generation should accommodate larger player size, since more than 3 players in a map can be very hectic and you're just spamming spacebar and skills until the room is cleared. There are just too many flashes and bangs when there are more than 2 players. 

I think 2 players is the sweet spot as of now. 

Bosses become very easy once you clear multiple times. There should be additional boss patterns according to the difficulty. 

Overall, I'd recommend this game only on sale.

Alright 10 hours played so far and I'd like to point out some things now-

This game is great, smooth gameplay and lots of fun with friends. Love the style and can't wait for more content.
So if anyone reads through this please don't think it's a bad game because it's awesome, this is really just an observation- 

Ok so this game needs help in the weapon balancing and Skills/Relics area a little bit.
Some examples: the Sword, the very first weapon is so strong. It takes no effort to breeze through every enemy and boss.
Then there's the Bow, it's pretty fun but hard to use until it you collect lots of power. 
When it comes to the others (especially the Hammer), my god they need tweaking so that you don't just feel like your fighting sponges.

For the Skills and Relics me and my friends found most of them to be meh at best if not just no good. I forget the names but I'd say a good amount we just skipped over because once we found the ones we beat the game with we'd see no reason to pick anything else, or when we did we would lose the round because they were too weak/inconsistent.

138368195.review:
Great game! I only have good things to say. 

The artstyle is adorable and the sound design is beautiful. very well done. 

The gameplay is solid. when i die, i know it was because of my own mistakes or shortcomings, never because of a stupid/faulty/unresponsive control or game mechanic.

The game is slightly difficult, but the controls are easy to pick up and learn. Once you get that down its so much fun. But the mastering the game is totally different. It feels so good playing Ember Knights. Every time i successfully dodge or perfect a skill is pure dopamine. Very well designed, I cannot wait for the full release!


Things to please keep:
- The ember store in the nexus, as it keeps ember relevant and helps gives players a boost
- SHOOOOP?... I love the "shoooop?" mechanics, please don't change that!
- the lategame "forge" or class customization for weapons. it helps to prevent the game from growing too mundane/mono-tone. everyone loves just a little customization.
- the ability to play split screen. some friends and I now have "Ember Knight-Nights" where we eat pizza and play this game for hours. non of us can wait for the full release!
- the dash/dodge. I feel like that is a core mechanic of the game. to give it a longer cool-down would make the game needlessly unpleasant.

Things to add/change:
- maybe add more random rooms or encounters like the shoooop? or the mimic king. This is just more fun! I wouldnt want there to be too many though, and have it water down the other amazing special encounter rooms. So far what you guys have is great, i would want 1 or 2 more just to spice things up.
- more colors!
- if possible, more secret things to find and discover. This would add alot more excitement and motivation to explore and replay.
- *spoiler warning!!* try to add a reward or bonus for players revisiting secret locations. example; that secret house in the third world that is only opened by a wisp. Its so cool! I was blown away when i first saw it, and i go inside whenever i replay it. I admit, its a little disappointing to only find an empty table every time :)
- this may be redundant because ive seen ..."hints?"... please add a 6th weapon class. that would be dope.

138069757.review:
A really fun hack n slash romp, solo or coop. Healthy balance of meta progression and mid-run progression. The unlocks and secrets give enough incentive to go for another run. There are plenty of options for mid-run progression and you have just the right amount of control over the direction your build takes. Minibosses have several variations that keep each run feeling just that much more varied.

If you are coming from Hades, this seems to be one of the best coop games to capture the same feel of high octane combat. Casting is a bit more intricate, with two spell slots and a cooldown system that requires to you do more hack'n'slashing to get your abilities back.

At time of writing this, the early access is far enough along to entertain for dozens of hours, especially if you play with friends.

137490482.review: Ember Knights has by far been one of my favorite Roguelites in a long time. It has really strong progression and a variety of weapons, skills, powers that allows a fundamental change in game play when added in different combinations. The world themes are constructed and implemented well. Each of the worlds brings a new enemy that isn't just a re-skin of a previous world. The enemies bring new attacks that lend to the increasing challenge found in this style of game. Balance is delivered between the Roguelike game play, the RPG character progression and the creative and new story. The art really guides the aesthetic of the game with each of the enemies and characters being easily identifiable and fitting to their world. Being able to select the Spark's color is more fulfilling that I initially expected. Even the detail of of the Spark's design adjusting to the weapon selection was unexpected but very welcome. Ember Knights is so engaging that I've begun telling my friends to try the game if for anything just to get into the multiplayer format.

Even in its current Early Access state, Ember Knights is a fantastic Co-Op Action Roguelike with fast combat, fun builds, and great boss design. one of the best rogues ive EVER played, it has such a way with balance that makes every run enjoyable and incredibly broken builds are way more common then the likes of the enormous TBOI or the brutal Dead Cells,  but i find that despite how easy the game actually is, its incredibly fun to play and has an unbelievable level of dopamine from constantly upgrading yourself.

this is all singleplayer talk, but the game has the very unique attribute of multiplayer, and its really unlike any other roguelike/roguelite ive ever played

the way the game handles skills is genius, instead of placing them on a basic timer, in order to regen your skills you have to land attacks on enemies which is a very unique and refreshing way to play a roguelike, as well as charging being a universal feature on all skills, and if you release the moment it fully charges, you will get a "Perfect" skill which is much more powerful, not to mention the depth thats added with classes like the Wizard, who focuses a lot on skills and having the ability to recharge them the fastest via his multi-hit charge attack that hits in a cone infront of him

136750509.review:
ようやくマルチプレイができたのでレビュー

ほかの人も書いているが、ザックリ言うとマルチプレイができるHades。
言語依存はそこまで強くないので、Googleグラス片手に遊べば余裕で楽しめる。

Hadesをわからない人向けに一応書くと、
[list]
  [*]ベースは歯ごたえ抜群のアクションゲーム
  [*]ステージが始まると部屋に敵が出現し、すべての敵を倒し切ると次の部屋に行ける
  [*]部屋は一方通行で戻ることはできないが、次の部屋が分岐することがある
  [*]各部屋にはクリア報酬があり、分岐する場合は何がもらえるか事前に分かる
  [*]ステージごとに部屋の数は決まっており、途中に中ボス、最後にステージボスが待っている
  [*]途中で倒れると成長ポイントを持ってホームに戻り、強化して再挑戦ができる
  [*]ゲームが進むごとにホームの要素がアンロックされ、使える武器の種類も増える
[/list]
... といった感じ。

アクション性は非常に出来が良く、動かしていて気持ちが良い。基本は連続攻撃、溜め攻撃、回避の3つで、サブでアクティブスキルが2種類持てる。

このゲームを歯ごたえ抜群にしているのが、”連続攻撃中に回避ができない”、"一度回避したら数秒は回避できない"というガチ硬派なアクション性。どこかの狩猟ゲームのような回避最優先入力の受付はしてもらえないので、[b]「敵の攻撃をしっかり覚えてしっかり避ける」[/b]ができないと最初のボスに行く前に死んでしまうだろう。

そんな骨太ゲームだが、マルチプレイになっても非常に良いバランスでみんなを苦しめてくれる。ソロよりは明らかに楽なのだが、このゲームは[b]雑魚が普通にスーパーアーマー持ってる上に基本回復アイテムが出ない[/b]という鬼仕様なので、油断したり気が緩めば簡単に被弾するし死ぬ。回復ビルドを組んでも被ダメージが非常にデカいので、ゴリ押しは不可能。特にボスは気を抜いた瞬間に死ぬ。死んでも誰かが生きていればゲームは続くが、蘇生ポイントは”回復の泉”または”ミニボス・ボスの撃破後”に限定される。ボス戦は最高に楽しく、最後の1人になった時のヒリヒリ感などは久しぶりに良い意味でのスリルを味わえた。

ちなみにマルチの際の各プレイヤーの成長度は個人のセーブデータを引き継ぐ。ジョブのアンロックは一番進んでいる人の解放分まで選択が可能。この辺りは今後正式リリースまでに仕様が変わる可能性もあるかもしれない。

辛口ながらも非常に良いバランスでまとめられているので欠点を書くのが難しいのだが、1つはマルチプレイのMVP発表。いろいろと評価によっておめでとうしてくれるのだが、なぜか最初にMVPを教えてくるので「いや、違うだろｗｗ」ってツッコみたくなってしまう。最後にMVPを出してくれれば「で、誰なんだ... ？」って楽しみが味わえるのだが... この評価は報酬があるわけではないので余計にもったいなく思った。

2つめに画面の忙しさによる視認性の悪さだが、これに関してはアートの方向性的に限界があると思うのでまあいいかなという感もある。

3つめはガッツリのアクションゲームなので遊ぶ人・勧める人を選んでしまう点。ただ、アクション性で勝負している作品である以上、難度を下げるというのは個性が死んでしまうことになるので正直このままで良いと思う。

これだけのクオリティで早期アクセスというのが正直信じられないのだが、今後もすごくなっていくということで期待しかない。ぜひみんなでこのヒリヒリ感を楽しんでほしい。

136421442.review:
Ember knights is the closest thing you will get to multiplayer Hades.  It's controls are smooth, and its weapon choices offer a wide range of playstyles. Many of its bosses/minibosses are incredibly designed.  There is a wide variety of enemies and each has unique play patterns!  The game feels good.  However, there are two large issues with the game that cause me to give it a downvote (for now). One of those issues will likely be fixed by the addition of more content (I know this is early access), but my biggest gripe remains.

The first and biggest issue is that the game does not currently function like a roguelike.  I beat it on my 2nd try.  That should not be POSSIBLE with a roguelike.  Roguelikes should scale sharply and force you to make incremental progress combined with incremental growth. It's GOOD to die in a roguelike. It means you get to try new stuff and spend your ember!  Each playthrough should feel like you're making progress, but there should also be areas that far exceed your capacity.  Frankly, you start this game about 90% as powerful as you can be, so the incremental growth between sessions is so negligible that this game can hardly be called a roguelike.  I DONT WANT TO BE ABLE TO BEAT THE GAME on my 2nd playthrough. And multiplayer exacerbates this problem greatly...

The other problem is that there is a distinct lack of content.  Your choices and build options are heavily limited and you will see the same upgrades over and over.  I saw 6 shops throughout my playthrough and EVERY SINGLE ONE offered both frostwall and the lightning-static-field-upgrade.  This feels distinctly problematic in multiplayer because there is such lack of variety in the upgrades that almost everyone winds up on the same build path.  There is no diversity.
Also, for multiplayer can we make sure that no player can pick up more than 1 of the offered rewards per room?  If you're going to drop 1 reward per player, please just lock 1 reward per player. 


------
As to balancing... 
Static field is absolutely broken, especially on archers and mages who can spam a bunch of attacks safely.  Frankly static field makes archers able to stun-lock large sections of any room.  2 archers with static field are effectively invincible against normal mobs.  This is not compelling gameplay. Perhaps give enemies invulnerability to cc for a second after being cc'd?

Frozen wall is not a great spell, but it is the LITERAL only way to freeze things for the freeze build.  There need to be more freeze options.  Also make sure that freeze doesn't break the game the same way static field currently does.

There needs to be more lateral AND vertical growth at the ember tree.  Players should get significantly stronger. Not 6% stronger, but like 50% stronger (make enemies scale harder too). I want to feel like I can become substantially stronger than I am.
 Also, why give players 2 spells to start. Lock one of their spell slots so that they have an upgrade option for 2.  Also, one of the upgrade options has to be to give players an increased chance to see rare upgrades at the ember tree.  There's a lot of options for lateral growth (more powers, more dashes, more improvement options). Frankly, the enemies in this game are spot on. You dont need more/better enemies, you need more/better player improvements!  

Skill builds are just bad right now. Either introduce some more synergies for skill-damage or buff the current stuff for skill-builds.

Oh last thought - please scale up multiplayer more. The difference in difficulty between 1p and 4p is ENORMOUS.

135143073.review: I'll tell you right now, this game scratches EVERY itch you might have in this blissful blend of Rogue-Likes and Beat'Em-Ups. Without spoiling too much of the content, I assure you that the price tag is well worth it for a game of this quality and STILL being under new updates. The upgrade system gradually allows you to build around your ideal play style, and the progression allows you to explore and practice with different relics/weapons/skills each run, instead of bombarding you with everything all at once. IT IS HARD to put down and MUCH harder to master. As of now I can full clear on base difficulty in 18 minutes tops, but experimenting with the increased difficulties really requires you to have sharpened your skills. Dodge, Attack, Skill-Cancel, 'Perfect' Skill Timing, and much more! (GET FRIENDS FOR MULTIPLAYER, IT IS A FULL PARTY with 4 people).

135020612.review:
是一款名氣不高但優秀的作品。

戰鬥的步調很快，一局以目前開放4個世界的情況約1小時內能打完。
武器在去年更新後總共有5種。預計還會至少增加一種。每種武器玩起來的感覺很不同。
最值得稱讚的是武器的Mod系統。這個系統讓每種武器又衍生出了不同的玩法（攻擊模式或額外效果改變）及更多變化性。
不過這個系統需要點時間才能解鎖開。（沒記錯的話是破兩輪）

技能新增的速度比較慢，但是選擇也不算少。遊戲裡有完美施放這個系統。
技能使用時蓄力到剛好滿的時候施放會有額外增強的效果。各技能不同。
由於可以觸發許多遺物效果，是個很重要的系統。

遺物的部分每次更新都新增了一些，總數量很多。
後期開的遺物讓遊戲有較不同的感覺。
在還沒解鎖那麼多遺物前會覺得變化性不夠多。不過遊戲整體的流派玩法還是讓人感覺中規中矩主要那幾種。
效果：毒，火，冰，雷，暈，治療 觸發：完美施放、閃避、擊中、擊殺、爆擊。大致上效果+觸發配對組成遺物效果。
算是這款比較可惜的地方。

多人連線最多4人。
進度看房主，技能、遺物、其他解鎖功能必須自己另外解，不共享在別人的房裡解鎖的功能（即使在隊伍一起遊戲期間解鎖），但可以使用。這點實在很不好。
多人遊戲時怪物血量增加導致單人無法在控場期間將怪殺死。
連續控場會有效果時間減少的問題的因此玩家必須合作集火。
所有掉落物除補品外一人一份，但可以把屬性球讓給隊友打造超特化角色。
但也因為補品並沒有比單人多而且還吃共通復活次數的關係導致這個遊戲越多人玩難度反而越高。

房間採分歧選擇式。每一關卡有3隨機1的小boss及固定的大boss。中途有機率遇到精英或冠軍房間。
希望大boss也能有變體隨機性。
透過解鎖可出現寶箱怪和史萊姆房。其餘房間則是錢、餘燼、技能、遺物、各屬性球、屬性3選1及補血和商店。
（解鎖後還有灰燼）

遊戲難度是各項目由玩家調整自訂的（敵人攻擊力、數量等）。
上手難度一開始玩其實覺得偏難。但會組合遺物效果及餘燼樹點高後難度減少很多。
在解鎖武器MOD之後普通難度基本上完全沒有過關問題。

整體來說，除了多人模式的系統我覺得好壞一半以及遊戲內容仍偏少外，非常推薦這款。
節奏快，動作流暢，打擊手感佳及每1-1.5個月穩定的更新內容。
一局的遊戲時間也很剛好，容易讓人隨時想到就開起來玩個一兩局。

遊戲目前沒有中文。需求語言程度不高，因為關鍵字都有不同顏色註記。
如果仍需要中文翻譯的話，指南那邊我貼了一篇可供單字對照參考。

134576266.review:
WARNING: Not much content in the game as of March 2023.  It took me less than 2 hours to unlock a good chunk of the game and complete a full successful run.  There are currently 4 worlds and 8 bosses - and with the right power set you can breeze through them in around 45 minutes or so.  If you are skilled enough at the genre you can full clear on your 2nd or 3rd run.

Ember Knights is a lot of fun.  Combat is fluid and fun, skills are interesting with some combos feeling powerful, and it handles just like you would expect.  The boss fights are really well done and the best part of the game so far while room combat is mostly the same ol thing over and over.

I would not call any part of this game "revolutionary" and it isn't Hades by far, but it has a unique "less hardcore" charm to it that is pleasant. 

I have yet to play multiplayer myself, however the videos I watched of it showed me one major annoyance - the camera only follows P1.  The camera really needs to split the difference using some algorithm so other players are not constantly shoved to the edge.

If I crush a game in less than 2 hours I typically will refund it - but this one will stay in my library so I can pick it back up in a year or so when the developers have had more time to release content.

Feb 2024 edit: they added a plethora of new achievements, which is fine, but many of these require hours of *repetitive grinding for THOUSANDS of kills* and are NOT retroactively counting past kills, so it would take far too many replays of the same content grinding just to fully complete achievements. The game is simply NOT fun to play at that point, so I will be changing my review to a negative review for this reason.

Great casual game anyone can pick up -- I'm a noob to this genre but still found it extremely fun and easy to play after getting used to enemy attack patterns. The relics selections make every game fresh and different as you can have wildly different builds from one game to the next, and with the addition of new relics every now and then along with balancing changes something that might be meta just a few months before can turn mediocre with a new meta now. Almost all relic combos are interesting and there's many different synergies, super fun to mix and match. The easter eggs in this game are all rather clever and fun/satisfying to discover too :D Mimic king relic unlock is the most frustrating for 100% completionists but game's still in early access with tons more content and stuff planned and consistent updates!

TLDR; awesome game, tons of unlocks. also can smacky smack or slice n dice or zappy zap or pew pew or choppy chop

update: even more content added with looping to be able to experience getting everything you ever wanted! more achievements and a new fancy final boss battle have polished this game greatly, it's immensely enjoyable!!

CLEAN EDIT:

This game is basically a room-based roguelite in the same vein as Hades. It has the same metagame. If you like Hades, you'll probably like this too, especially if you love pixel-stylized graphics.

With that said, there some very jarring issues you need to consider:

> The game is somewhat close to Hades in price, but is about 20% cheaper. Now you'd expect 20% less content AT WORST, or at best, far more content due to how this has NO VOICE ACTING IN THE LEVEL OF HADES, and IT HAS A FAR MORE EASIER TO DESIGN GRAPHICAL STYLE.
>> But nope, this game is about 50% less in content compared to Hades. The game, before launch, was at 0.11. And then suddenly it was 1.0. Go figure.

> Cheap reliance on difficulty. At 1.0, the game's difficulty was on the easier side, but this was because the controls are SUPER RESPONSIVE and there's no attack commitments. Devs didn't like people beating the whole 1h campaign in less than 1h and cranked up enemy density to roughly 3x or more. They also attack WAY faster.
>> To add insult to that, the most recent update, as if charge attacks weren't an absolute trash of a mechanic, they made more mechanics revolve more on charge attacks. With now much more enemy density and how fast they attack (this is on normal, mind you), and you have half of the weapons literally losing half their power due to relying on charge attacks. On worlds 3+, charge attacks become IMPOSSIBLE to do. So forget about using hammer.
>>> A lot of these charge attacks rely on perfect timing. It's not just charging attacks and you'll be good, even skills need to be charged to get their full potential. Their base functions suck if you don't time the releases right or charge them, and this becomes especially important in world 3++.

These devs decided not just to cut content and then add it later into the game in the guise of a "free update cos we good guys" type of scummy BS move, they also do not play their own game and listen to the community re: balance. They just throw enemies at you, cut animation charges of enemies and half, and then called it a day.

Do not support these developers in the future. Even Skul, with it's atrocuious balance as well, fares better than this. Better buy Astral Ascent instead, that one is gorgeous and has very nice balance.

133144417.review:
Ember Knights, even in early access (v0.9.1), is already one of the best rogue-lites available on the market. The production gets it right in practically all aspects and offers, as the icing on the cake, co-op multiplayer for up to 4 players. I have yet to test the multiplayer which, by numerous reports, provides a polished and entertainment-rich experience. So I'll stick to single-player in the comments.

First, the story is set in the world of Nexus, where the Ember Tree, a tree whose leaves are blue flames, symbolizes balance. However, an evil sorcerer named Praxis threatens tranquility by sucking energy from the plant and it is up to the flaming knights to face him. Simple and effective background, with the presence of additional characters to enhance the plot.

Mechanics do not reinvent the wheel. There are hack n' slash and ranged combat, in which the player will choose one of the five available weapons for his run, varying attributes such as HP, damage and critical hits. There are four distinct scenarios, each containing mini-boss, boss and several rooms that are seen linearly, full of enemies, normal or special versions, elite and champion. Their diversity and quantity is good and the game is visually communicative in indicating to the player their movement patterns and attacks, encouraging them to determine their own approaches to combat.

Regarding the strategy, in addition to the initially chosen weapon, there are skills - complementary powers/spells -, relics - passive effects - and gems, which represent upgrades such as speed and spell strength, among the others mentioned above. Sometimes it will be possible to decide between two options before advancing to the next room, for example: increase HP or damage? room to receive a new skill or relic?. That said, adding to the coin management - purchase of items in stores - the flames (ember), used in the tree to acquire permanent upgrades and the presence of special areas and secrets, make Ember Knights a comprehensive title - and there a vast end-game planned for v1.0.

It wouldn't do any good if the balance was inadequate - although some builds are a little overpowered, the overall balance is good and will only get better given the dev team's attention to feedback. The default difficulty is well tuned and it is possible to significantly increase the challenge using unlockable modifiers after the first victory. In addition, and amazingly given the amount of game facets, it does a great job of presenting all its features: nice, clean and effective user interface.

Technically, the high quality standard is maintained. The pixel-art is expressive and accompanied by a good soundtrack, even if the sound mix leaves something to be desired regarding music volume variability. Finally, we find a frantic gameplay, very responsive and without excessive buttons.

In short, Ember Knights is such a cohesive production that the fact of playing it safe as to the execution of its conception is in no way a negative point - it packs the best within the style of the rogue-like genre, adds multiplayer, an extra spice via its setting and closes the set with a dynamic gameplay, generating epic moments like in battles against bosses. Solid established base and promising future. Highly recommended!

- - - [pt-br] - - - 

Ember Knights, mesmo em early access (v0.9.1), já é um dos melhores rogue-lites disponíveis no mercado. A produção acerta em praticamente todos os aspectos e oferece, como a cereja do bolo, multiplayer co-op para até 4 jogadores. Ainda não testei o multijogador o qual, segundo inúmeros relatos, fornece uma experiência polida e rica em entretenimento. Sendo assim, vou me ater ao single-player nos comentários.

Primeiramente, a história é ambientada no mundo de Nexus, onde a Ember Tree, árvore cujas folhas são chamas azuis, simboliza o equilíbrio. Entretanto, um feiticeiro maligno chamado Praxis ameaça a tranquilidade ao sugar a energia do vegetal e cabe a cavaleiros flamejantes enfrentarem-no. Plano de fundo simples e eficaz, com presença de personagens adicionais para incrementarem a trama.

A mecânica não reinventa a roda. Há combate hack n' slash e ranged, no qual o jogador escolherá uma das cinco armas disponíveis para a sua run, variando-se atributos como HP, dano e porcentagem de acertos críticos. Existem quatro cenários distintos, cada um contendo mini-boss, boss e diversas salas que são encaradas linearmente, repletas de inimigos, normais ou as versões especiais, elite e champion. A diversidade e quantidade dos mesmos é boa e o jogo é visualmente comunicativo em indicar ao player seus padrões de movimentação e ataques, incentivando que o próprio determine suas abordagens nos combates.

Em relação à estratégia, além da arma optada inicialmente, há as habilidades - poderes complementares/magias -, relíquias - efeitos passivos - e gemas, as quais representam upgrades como velocidade e força de magia, dentre os demais citados anteriormente. Por vezes, será possível decidir entre duas opções antes de avançar para a próxima sala, por exemplo: aumentar o HP ou o dano? sala para receber uma nova habilidade ou relíquia?. Isto posto, somado ao gerenciamento das moedas - compra de itens nas lojas - das chamas (ember), usadas na árvore para aquisição de upgrades permanentes e da presença de áreas especiais e segredos, tornam Ember Knights um título abrangente - e há a previsão de um vasto end-game para a v1.0.

De nada adiantaria se o balanceamento fosse inadequado - apesar de algumas builds serem um pouco OP, o equilíbrio geral é bom e só tende a melhorar dada a atenção da equipe de desenvolvimento aos feedbacks. A dificuldade padrão é bem ajustada e é possível aumentar significativamente o desafio utilizando-se de modificadores desbloqueáveis após a primeira vitória. Além disso e, por incrível que pareça dada a quantidade de nuances, o jogo faz um ótimo trabalho em apresentar todos os seus recursos: interface de usuário agradável, limpa e eficaz. 

Tecnicamente, o alto padrão de qualidade é mantido. A pixel-art é expressiva e acompanhada por boa trilha sonora, ainda que a mixagem de som deixe a desejar em relação à variabilidade dos volumes das músicas. Por fim, encontramos uma jogabilidade frenética, bastante responsiva e sem botões em excesso.

Em suma, Ember Knights é uma produção tão coesa que o fato de jogar seguro quanto à execução de sua concepção em hipótese alguma é um ponto negativo - empacota o que há de mais interessante dentro do estilo do gênero rogue-like, adiciona multiplayer, um tempero extra via sua ambientação e fecha o conjunto com uma gameplay dinâmica, gerando momentos épicos como nas batalhas contra chefões. Sólida base estabelecida e futuro promissor. Recomendadíssimo!

133110092.review:
협동 탑뷰 로그라이트 게임, "엠버나이츠"
기본적으로 PC기준 키보드 & 마우스 트윈스틱 조작이다.

퀄리티 높은 도트, 준수한 OST와 연출, 적당한 길이의 런타임.
게임성은 충분히 좋다. 물론, 역대 로그라이트 명작들에 비하면 아이템의 개수나 조합 등 스케일이 터무니없이 작지만, 아직 얼리이고 이정도 퀄리티면 보장된 성공이라 봐도 무방하다고 생각한다. (스컬이 그랬다)

 몰입을 해치지않는 선에서 재미를 챙기는 장치도 여럿있다.
나름 보상이 있는 비밀(이스터에그)이 그 예이며, 게임 내 수많은 비밀들이 숨겨져있다.
또한 중간중간 등장하는 농담따먹기도 하나의 보는 맛이라고 할 수 있었다.

이런 농담따먹기들은 전투중에는 절대 이루어지지않으며 전투가 끝나거나 아예 마을에 있을때만 진행한다.

그외 좋았던 점으로는 온라인 멀티플레이의 편의성이 미친듯이 좋다는 점이다.
다른 멀티게임들은 로컬플레이와 리모트플레이를 이용하기위해 온라인플레이까지 같이 카메라뷰를 나눈다던지, 조작키가 다르다던지 할텐데 이 게임은 온라인 멀티에서 플레이어마다 각각의 카메라를 가지고있는등 뛰어난 편의성을 보인다.

133106623.review:
I've had this game in my wishlist for soooo long waiting for the updates to be done. I checked this past week to see where things were at and decided it was close enough. Lol. I couldn't wait anymore.

What an absolute treat!!! Played this game for about an hour with the wifey and it was a blast. Then a couple of good friends of ours came on and wanted to play something, so they grabbed this game to try with us. We ended up playing for three more hours. Lol. 

More rogue like games need to have multiplayer fleshed out like this game does. Playing solo is great enough. The combat is smooth, and there so many different ways to kit out your character to keep the gameplay fresh. This fun factor is multiplied when you add friends because you can talk strategy and do some cool team combinations. Everyone can be their own unique character with a unique playstyle, which is so refreshing. We've barely started unlocking weapons/skills, but it's obvious we all will have plenty of unique options to choose from. More ways to play is always a plus.

Maybe it's because I'm 35, but the pixely/Super Nintendo art style was an instant draw. Having the four characters be very distinct, different colors helps with keeping track of yourself in all the chaos. Enemy and boss design/art style is anything but generic. We all have a collective "WOAH!!!" when we first saw the boss of the undead world (3rd world i believe?).

I hope this game continues to get much more content and support after it's "official" release. I would happily pay for more content to keep playing in this world.

10/10 must play of you're in to rogue like rpgs, especially if you want a fun game to play with your friend.

133013839.review: I bought this game yesterday and have been playing it non-stop with my boyfriend. For context, I do not like rogue-lite/dungeon crawlers. If they are too difficult or too easy, I will not play it. I much prefer farming games like Stardew or open world games like Valheim and Grounded. This has found the perfect balance between ramping difficulty between worlds and ramping power of your character. It is incredibly fun with incredibly whimsical and clever character designs. Each character really stands out, even the mobs. I can really tell that a lot of care has been put into each aspect of the game. Even each skill feels very unique and fun (summoning spirits is my favorite). I love finding new synergies between skills and relics. Although there isn't much content out yet, and I've already gone the 4 worlds, I feel like this game has a lot of replay-ability. I can't wait to run it back with different strategies. I will be coming back for more when new content is released. Highly recommend 11/10!

132988754.review:
This game is great, it's basically a cross between Hades and Wizard of Legend, with some Castle Crashers mixed in.

Worth the price even now but I eagerly await more content being added. Right now the skill selection seems kinda small, but they're all fun to use. Synergies are REALLY strong but it's basically blind luck to get them even before the relic pool expands.

This game absolutely nails mechanical feel, everything feels intuitive and there's effectively almost no learning curve even when playing with someone who knows the game. It's really easy to get in the swing of things fast and get really good quick. The gap between high ember and low ember isn't as high as it seems, and in-run bonus synergies are strong.

I tend to like the melee movesets and going full aggro and I feel like another weapon or two tailored towards that would be great, because at the moment there's two melee weapons, the standard one and the heavy one, but there's three different ranged weapons that all have wildly different mechanics.

132763284.review:
This game is fantastic.  If you are at all interested in these hack n slash or action rpg style 'roguelikes' or whatever you like to call them, this is one of the very best.  Very fun game even if you are 100% single player.

Also, do NOT be deterred by the fact it's in EA.  This is already a full game for the most part, as this is one of I think THREE games I have come across and played that has done early access RIGHT (the other 2 being Nova Drift and Hades...).   

Also, and of course this is purely subjective, but for some reason Hades did not really do it for me but Ember Knights DID. I'm having a lot more fun with Ember Knights even though it's a smaller game (personally, I think it's the perfect 'size' for this type of game).  Maybe some of it has to do with the fact that I enjoy quality pixel-art games and this is one of the very best in recent memory, but the combat and everything else is also extremely well-done.

Highly recommended for fans of hack n slash games and recommended for anyone else who even thinks they might like the game -- chances are you will.  Excellent game and fantastic job with EA.  These are the type of games/devs we should all be supporting!

132596390.review:
The game is fun, but I'm not sure there's enough replayability for me personally to merit the $15 pricetag. I beat the current content after 3 hours, and unlocked [spoiler]weapon upgrades[/spoiler] after 5. I feel like I've already experienced everything the game has to offer after 5 hours. I wish [spoiler]weapon upgrades[/spoiler] were unlocked earlier, so I could experiment a bit more and maybe keep interest a bit longer before seeing everything in the game. I may have never even played more to unlock them if my friend didn't want to play coop.

The weapons need some tweaks. The only weapon that felt good to use was the sword. Being locked in weapon animations and unable to dodge does not feel good. I want to like the other weapons, but animation locks/stuck in place make them nigh unplayable. In a fast-paced roguelite like this, every weapon should feel highly mobile and controllable. This might be the change that would improve replayability the most.

Freeze may need a rebalance. The "Freeze on Perfect Skill" relic completely trivializes 90% of the game except for bosses. You freeze all mobs then hit them 5-10 times then can freeze them again before they can move. Rinse and repeat. It makes the run overpowered, but in a boring, tedious, damage-sponge way.

Current post-game (alla Hades "heat") is just raw stat buffs to enemies, which is not interesting at all. It's not interesting enough to me to continue playing much more.

TL;DR - Game is fun, but does not have enough replayability currently to merit $15 pricetag. Wait for more content/full release.

131841290.review:
I was liking the progression of this game, but this last update took a lot out if it.

Instead of being "overpowered" and annihilating entire areas way to quick, everything is moved to the "armor" phase, and expects you to instead just slowly plod through taking hits.

I would have appreciated this, however, the agile characters are underpowered, and need to be built like tanks and played as such.
Something went wrong in last few patches where if character has "charge" and "tap" style attacks, it can stagger between both and not work properly. 
This last patch in particular, I find that roll canceling into an attack will occasionally result in roll being cancelled, and attack not starting. This really throws off the timing in intense situations.

I DO understand they are trying to reduce abuse of "on hit" effects, (mage) but there are simply better options, such as a cool-down on trigger, rather then just slowing attacks to unusable levels.
The mention involving mage in particular, was that they wanted people to use more skills not spam rapid auto attack... Cool...
Why are skills being continuously nerfed to uselessness, with most recent being chakram? (NO damage numbers? very slow, low damage, 2 bounces point blank?)

I was really enthusiastic for this game and got it for several friends, but it was sketchy to begin with, and now its not even fun.

Armor up, slog through... dont even care by 3rd map...

131724628.review:
Ok, after beating the game for the 4th time in a row, I feel that I can give some solid input. 

Firstly: Ice is the most over powered ability in this game. It is game breaking, and makes each run extremely easy. You can "freeze" ANY enemy except bosses and mini bosses for 2.5 seconds. There is no cool down for this, so you can perma stun every enemy and just slowly destroy them. Once this gets fixed, the game will actually be challenging, but until then, it's a breeze!

Secondly: The game itself is amazing, it's the small things that make games so great. The controls are very good, and everything seems to work so well. 

Lastly: Even though it is in early access, I have seen very little bugs. I did run into one game ending one, where I somehow clipped through a wall, and I couldn't get back to the game. That was unfortunate, but it has only happened once in the 10 times I have played.

TLDR: The game is great, play it, and have fun! Adding other players into the game makes the game go from easy, to VERY easy, but fun none the less.

131699320.review:
Excellent game! Feedback so far based on this stage of early access:

Pros: SO MANY

Combat is excellent, the variety of weaponry is good with very different attack styles and benefits between each. The skills you can acquire add to the fun and flair of the game, and the relics (various buffs) can result in some very fun builds. The pixelart is AMAZING! The animators did an incredible job. The combat (OH GOSH THE COMBAT) is absolutely awesome. Because of how different each weapon is, it adds a HUGE amount of replay value. There are actually benefits to dying, which is a REALLY nice touch - you're actively rewarded when you return to the first area after death OR success with additional unlocks. The difficulty is high and requires some fast reflexes, but the developers are more forgiving with damage than some other roguelikes are - you're never gonna get one shotted, and it's not exactly like you can only take five hits before you're out, so you feel like you can still survive despite the huge amount of combat and decently plentiful enemies. The bosses and minibosses are fantastically programmed and difficult, making it very rewarding to defeat each one. I was surprised that it has a decent emphasis on story, with generally fun and eclectic characters and a comparatively intriguing antagonist. There's enough mystery surrounding this figure to where you kinda wanna know "who or what is he really?", but it's not necessary for the enjoyment of the game. He pops in at random times in the dungeons, often when you're taking a lot of damage, and it adds some neat tension to the intense combat. 

Cons:

Like most EA games, it suffers from a lack of content. Though there are 5 weapons already, four areas, probably close to 12-16 different minibosses (4 with what seems like maybe 4 variants apiece, only found a few variants so far), 4 main bosses, and a decently wide variety of unlockables, the game is definitely incomplete. 

I would like to see even more base game weapons, with additional kinds being unlockable via a DLC expansion or something later on. Some of the weapons seem unbalanced compared to others - the bow, though weak, is wicked fast and makes it easy to avoid enemies (it's so good its borderline broken), the basic sword has some of the highest damage output as well as the best mobility, but the other three weapons (staff, hammer, and ninja star thing) feel comparatively meh, in my own opinion. The staff has VERY weak basic attack with a charge attack that feels like it takes too long and leaves you too exposed to attack. While the staff hits fast and it's nice that it's meant to boost skill damage, it's really hard to get past even basic enemies in the beginning, especially if you're used to the range the bow has. Due to its emphasis on skill damage, if your skills are recharging, you're kinda stuck with dealing little to no damage with your basic attack. It serves little purpose other than recharging your skills. More skilled players may enjoy this, but I'm not a fan of it personally. The hammer CAN be more powerful than the sword in that it has a wide area of attack and each part of the combo can be charged for extra damage (a nice touch, that), but it suffers from being severely slow in a game where the emphasis on movement is everything. The ninja star thing has some really cool stuff going for it, as it's the single highest crit rate weapon with the potential for the greatest damage output as a result, but it also suffers from less mobility than other weapons. It would be cool to have it maybe maintain PART of the slow mobility, while adding easier dodges or more invincibility frames. OR perhaps a short i-frame dodge where you can dodge mid-attack and the star boomerangs back to you wherever you go. 

The game is fairly short at the moment, but it feels like it's a lot of work just to get to area 4. I would love to see something like Risk of Rain 2, where the next world can be one of 2 or 3 randomized options, each with their own enemies and environmental challenges. 

Some of the relics and skills seem very weak, and others are borderline game breaking. For example, if you have a relic that allows you to burn enemies, such as one that makes your first attack burn, then there is another relic that makes it so that enemies get stunned when they're burned. This effectively freezes the enemy in place, removing all resistance from them and making them very easy to dispatch. This relic alone allowed me to beat the game very easily the first time I got it. As useful as it was, it took some fun out of the game, as the very difficult 4th area enemies were suddenly very easy to kill. 

Despite the cons, this is a game that is developing enough that I am excited to see how far it goes. I'm interested to see how things get rebalanced and to see what is added as the game grows.

This game is a labor of love. It's absolutely incredible, and so far I highly recommend it.

131175807.review:
Ember Knights is essentially an indie-er multiplayer-capable Hades with a cute fantasy aesthetic. If that sounds good, stop reading this review and buy it, you'll have a great time.

Ember Knights is structurally identical to Hades: pick a weapon that defines your run, go through four worlds with riffs on their same bosses and minibosses to build predictability while keeping things fresh, choose between two possible outcomes for the next room, and use the currency you gained during a run to buy swappable upgrades in a number of categories. If you liked that gameplay and progression system, you'll feel right at home here.

Ember Knights' combat is a little slower and more methodical, with more emphasis on charged attacks and commitment and less on dodging, which I definitely appreciate. Character upgrades found during a run depend less on your weapon and instead rely more on your chosen skills and elemental effects, which feels more like I'm making big meaningful decisions during my run instead of determining my all behaviors before I even step out of the gate with my weapon choice. Multiplayer is well executed and fun, with a well-behaved camera and clearly-delineated effects between each player.

130552138.review:
[h1]Ember knights is fast roguelike with very precise controls, awesome coop and all in all a very polished product[/h1]
The general play style and the games mechanics focus on timing. Be it because dodging attacks is more important than hitting enemies or because every skill or attack also has a second "perfect" variant that you can only pull off if you hold and release the attacks designated button in the perfect moment.

The games learning curve is reasonable. Everything feels very replicable. Hit boxes are precise. Damage is understandable.
There are nice unlocks like new skills and perks. The story is cute and doesn't take itself too serious, which is perfectly fine.
[i](Local) coop is a blast![/i]
It's impressive how polished the game already is. I played about 13 hours at the time of the review and I encountered to major flaws or bugs.

[b]There are only three minor concerns:[/b]
[u]1. Please make the game save after unlocking new stuff at the ember tree of the NPCs. I tend to spend my earned ember and relic orbs to see what I have unlocked after a completed run, but those purchases are not saved. I have to redo them when I quit and restart later.[/u]
2. Will there be a bigger variation of relics (perks) and skills on release? I hope so to increase the amount of variation / builds and thus replayability. More weapons would of course also be nice, but the existing ones are already very good.
3. Will the game also be released to other platforms? I can totally see a Switch or Playstation port.

130451870.review:
This is a really delightful roguelike!  The gameplay reminds me of the best parts of [i]Hades[/i] and [i]Curse of the Dead Gods[/i], which happen to be two of my favorite games.  Plus the little Ember Knights are adorable.  
  
Look, it's difficult to quantify what makes a roguelike good except that they evoke a singular feeling: [i]Just one more game![/i]  Ember Knight starts off right from the beginning giving players a lot of fun toys to use and combinations to play with, if you like the way [i]Dead Cells[/i], [i]Binding of Isaac[/i], and [i]Hades[/i] build up synergies then you'll like Ember Knight's gameplay loop.   
  
The combat itself is rock solid, tight as [i]Mega Man[/i].  I think I might actually hammer my face buttons harder in this game than in anything else in my library.  The special powers have a novel recharge mechanic wherein the player has to get so many strikes with their primary weapon (usually 10-20, depending on the powerup) before you can use your special again; it's a really fun little meta-game within the combat, specials are easy enough to recharge that I don't feel the need to hoard them, but they're spaced out well enough to keep them feeling special.  I like it!  
  
Players get plenty of weapons and powers to choose from, there is an enhancement track, "More strength," "Start with 50 gold" stuff like that.  There are lots of unlocks, I imagine it'll take me a while to get the entire upgrade path done, but on the bright side there are free respecs, so you're not punished for playing around.  
  
No notable Early Access tax!  I think it's a solid game as it is!  That said, I imagine that things like balance and whatnot will change between now and release, but the game as it is has enough content and enough [b]fun[/b] that it's easy to recommend.   

In more explicit terms: The federal minimum wage is $7.25/hr, I've gotten 6 hours of playtime out of Ember Knights (so far) and I paid $14.99 for it, like, there are some AAA $59.99 titles that only have 6 hours of gameplay.  Haven't run into any bugs, the gameplay is fun, the choices seem robust, if you're looking for a new roguelike to add to your library I think Ember Knights is absolutely worth your time!  
  
Edit: Oh, yeah, I forgot to mention that you'll die a lot.  Like, in a good way.  It's hard, but fun hard!

130450988.developer_response:
Hey there,

Ember Knights should support your Pro controller but you'll likely need to adjust a few settings. The following steps should get it to work:

1. Open Steam
2. At the top, click the "View" tab
3. Click "Big Picture Mode"
4. Click the Options Cog at the top right corner of the screen
5. Click "Controller Settings"
6. From here, Enable "Switch Pro Configuration Support"
7. You can now Enable or Disable "Use Nintendo Button Layout" to adjust how the controller is bound
8. Close Steam Big Picture mode
9. Right click the game in your Steam Library
10. Go to Properties then the Controller tab
11. You will see a dropdown menu called "OVERRIDE FOR EMBER KNIGHTS"
12. Change the Override to "Use default settings"
13. Return to steam
14. Restart the game

If that doesn't work, please contact us at support@doomturtle.ca or our Discord (https://discord.gg/emberknights) and we'll work with you to get it to work.

Brad

129747047.review:
[h1]触り心地が快適[/h1]

見下ろし型アクションでキーレスポンスが非常に良好。
単純に触っていて気持ちいい。

[h1]操作[/h1]

X：攻撃
A：ローリング回避
Y：スキル1
B：スキル2

となっていて、XとAの2ボタンを使って立ち回るのが戦闘の基本。

Xの攻撃は3連撃まで繋がるが攻撃の合間にローリング回避が挟めるようになっている。
またローリング中にXを押すことで突き攻撃ができるようになっている。

ローリング回避は完全無敵となっているが無敵時間が長め且つ敵の攻撃タイミングは予備動作がしっかりわかるようになっているので回避しやすく、ノーダメージで突破も比較的容易だ。

キャラの移動は左アナログスティックでも方向キーでもどちらにも対応しているのは地味に嬉しい。

[h1]バランス[/h1]

回復アイテムの出現が少ないが、その分優秀なローリング回避でしっかり避けろというゲーム側のメッセージが伝わる。

ローリングの性能が高めなこともあって安全重視に立ち回ればそんなにダメージを受けることがないので現状のバランスに不満はない。何しろ雑魚だけでなく中ボスとボスも攻撃前の予備動作がはっきりわかるのでアクションゲームに慣れているほど楽に立ち回れるからだ。

[h1]キーレスポンス[/h1]

一番最初にも書いたが快適。
押せばすぐに望ましい反応があり、気持ちよく動かせる。

「動きたいと思ったら動かせる」というのは当たり前だが本作はそれを高水準で達成できている印象を受けた。文句なし。

[h1]まとめ[/h1]

目新しさこそないが、まとまりが良好で遊んでいて素直に楽しかった。

なお、本作は日本語非対応となっているが、日本語非対応のアクションを触っていれば馴染みのある単語ばかりなので支障はなかった。もっともストーリーは全スルーだが。

とりあえず値段に見合った内容はあったのでこれからも遊んでいきたい。

[h1]2023年1月クリア追記[/h1]

ステージ4ボス撃破まで進めるバージョンでの武器レビュー。

弓＞杖＞剣＞槌＞十の所感でチャージ攻撃は全部使い道がない。

[b]＜十字手裏剣＞[/b]

デフォルトの剣より射程は長いが威力がさほど高くなく、連射も効かない。ついでに攻撃直後にローリングすると十字手裏剣が消えて攻撃がキャンセルされるという欠陥持ち。攻撃もやや遅い。

[b]＜槌＞[/b]

振りが遅いだけ。威力は剣より高い感じだが誤差レベル。動きながら攻撃する相手には滅法不利。

[b]＜剣＞[/b]

3回まで連続斬りができるが3回目は威力が上がる代わりに硬直がある。スタンダードで使いやすい反面、近接系の敵との乱戦時はリスクを背負う。

[b]＜杖＞[/b]

初期状態で最初からスキル枠が2つ埋まっているのでこれを通常攻撃とスキルを一緒に使っていく戦闘スタイル。通常攻撃の隙はないが火力が乏しく、スキル頼り。ただし通常攻撃に毒を付けるレリックがあるとそれなりに火力が出る。とはいえステージ2の時点で攻撃力をあげないと火力不足に陥り、雑魚戦が常に連打ゲーになる。

[b]＜弓＞[/b]

剣と同様に3連続で攻撃が出来、3回目の攻撃は硬直あり。攻撃速度が速く、威力もそれなりにあるので通常攻撃の威力を伸ばしていくと良いDPSが出せるため現状これが最強。

＜他気になったこと＞

ステージ4は縦に長い地形が度々出てくるが、上のほうからは画面外から遠距離攻撃をしてくるのは一方的にプレイヤーが不利なので修正してほしいものである。回復手段が限られているゲームで不意にダメージを受けるのは流石にいただけない。

あとステージ4の中ボスで円を内側から外側に2回放つ攻撃がボスの場所次第では2回目の回避がほぼ間に合わないケースがあるのでもう少し間隔を開けて欲しい。

＜スキルについて＞

バリスタが異様に強い。2回まで設置出来て、なぜか敵のヘイトを集めてくれるのでデコイのような使い方ができる。バリスタ自体の威力も普通に有用。

氷柱の地走りも直線状の敵すべてを氷漬けして一定時間一方的に攻撃できるので便利だった。

＜ゲームデザインとゲームバランス＞

良くも悪くもHADESに似ている部分が多く、HADESで個人的に微妙に思っていたところもそっくりそのまま。

慣れれば慣れるほど1プレイが長くなるがプレイ後に強化できる回数や種類が多いわけではないので強くなった実感が得られにくく、必然的にプレイ内容も変わり映えがなく、火力も伸びにくいゲーム性なので倒し飽きた敵だろうと一撃で気持ちよく倒すことが出来ずに何度も攻撃しなければ倒せず、それをひたすら繰り返すのでゲームとしての「飽き」が早めに来るという欠点がHADESのまま。

一言で言えばカスタマイズ含めた「遊び」の幅が狭い。

現状の最終到達地点は10回もプレイしないうちに辿り着いたが前半ステージが既に飽きている。HADESのときから感じていたが「1体倒すのに何度も攻撃を当てないと倒せない敵との戦闘をプレイするたびに繰り返しやらされる」のは苦痛なのである。

個人の嗜好で恐縮だが私が楽しいと感じるハクスラは
　・攻撃力を尖らせれば雑魚は一発か二発で倒せる
　・1プレイの度に色々強化できる
　・強化の幅が広い
と、いずれも「繰り返し楽しんでもらう」ことを意識されたゲームデザインだったのでそれが弱いHADESや本作とはリプレイ性に大きな差がついている。

好みの問題と言ってしまえばそれまでだが、本作はHADES同様に「何回かやれば飽きてしまう」プレイ体験の変化に乏しいゲームデザインだ。

今後のアップデートで劇的な変化を期待するほどピュアではないので、評価は今後も覆りそうになさそうだ。

「4人まで遊べるHADES似アクション」という結論で終わりそう。



[h1]正規リリース版の感想追記[/h1]

アーリーアクセスの頃から感じていたことだがステージ3から雑魚の硬さが気になってくるのでソロだと進行のテンポが一気に落ちる。特にステージ4は顕著でなかなか死なない敵を大量に倒さなければならないためプレイしていてつらい気持ちになる。

正規リリース版はいよいよステージ5が遊べるようになったが、きつい部分は変わらず、火力不足を常に感じる。もっとも使っている武器が弓というのもあるのだろうけど。このゲーム、近距離武器のリスクが高すぎるんだよなぁ…。

その後はラスボスの第2形態まで進んでエリア移動を行うシーンでよくわからん死に方をしたが、弓で攻略しようとするとソロはきついだけ。

マルチで遊ぶ分にはアーリーアクセスの頃からものすごく面白いゲームではあるので、現状だとマルチ前提な感じはする。倒れた味方も中ボス、大ボス撃破で自動復活するし、パーティゲームとしては悪くない。ただ可能なら「生き残っている味方のライフを消費して味方を復活」みたいな機能も欲しい。

なぜかというと実際にマルチで何度も遊んだ身としては、戦闘不能になって復活も使い切った味方が再度戦闘不能になると中ボス、大ボスを倒すまで「見ているだけ」になってしまうからだ。あれこれ雑談してわいわい楽しむこともできるが、早期に復活できるに越したことはない。4人で遊んで自分だけが生き残っていると若干気まずい感じもするのでそこらへんは検討してもらいたいものである。

129498427.review:
I'll preface this by saying that I'm quite experienced with rogue-lites and with this specific type of rogue-lite gameplay, but I wouldn't call myself a super hardcore elite gamer or anything. I've played most of the big and well-known rogue-lites and picked this one up on sale for around ¥1100. 

It's way too easy. About 90 minutes in, I completed my fourth run with a victory and a "more content coming soon" screen. I still have skills and relics to unlock, as well as one more weapon, but there doesn't seem to be much left to do content-wise and the game's just too easy for a rogue-lite. With no ascension or similar system to increase the difficulty of runs, I feel no desire to go unlock the rest of the stuff knowing that future runs will all be just as easy and go through the same 4 zones. None of the bosses took me more than one try to figure out, the three deaths I had were when I was just figuring out the controls and getting used to the mechanics, and I just kinda blasted through all of the areas and bosses solo without any close calls or difficult fights really. 

The gameplay feels solid, if rather simplistic, and it does feel fast-paced and fun. The art is very nice, the game is very nice to look at, and the music is pretty decent. I enjoyed it in a casual turn-off-brain kind of way, and for the amount I spent I'd say getting an enjoyable 1.6 hours out of it was good enough to recommend it as an early access title. 

I might come back in the future when they add more content, and I *really* hope some of that content includes higher difficulty options and some system to make future runs more difficult after completing your first one.

129344106.review:
如果你没朋友，不要买，单人玩相当劝退，玩星座上升 hades 死亡细胞去。
1.0公测后评价
数值仍然没有改，就是必须得拿普攻带毒才能玩，build几乎没有，有用的relics就那几个。虽然把之前第三关Boss清了，第四关mini boss技能是人玩的？ 召唤小弟+扔飞镖带回旋的+自己超高移速追杀，有时候还来光圈，必须非常好的走位和接连闪避才行，这个就是纯恶心人。

刮痧问题之前出现在第三关（最后一关），现在还是最后一关，放第四关了，就突然之间打不动小怪了，你说离谱吧，我还基本一路都拿的加攻击的宝石，这样拿攻击有啥意义？


打boss就是刮痧磨血，这游戏真是稀烂趁早倒闭吧亏我EA很早买了。人家星座上升，几乎每个版本都在加东西，改机制，每次更新玩得特别爽，到你这就是受苦来着的。

------
重复性较高，堆怪问题严重，玩得很折磨，好不容易局外升级了，进图特么的怪物小boss也给我升级了，一个冰骑士变两个了？？？！！！那我局外升级有啥意义呢？
开局没拿到普攻带毒，基本就没法速通，打不进7分钟，根本不是技术问题，就是伤害问题好吧。
武器也是鸡肋没啥玩法，法师棒攻速快，范围远，还带自动锁怪，还自带一个技能，相比之下其他武器没啥玩的了。近战也没啥玩头，游戏武器、技能都没有平衡性，而且relics 遗物也做得稀烂。

不如去玩传说法师，Hades, 星座上升。对这个游戏很失望，看宣传挺好，一直愿望单很久。

129320069.review:
How have I never heard of this game before today? 

Ember Knights is a colorful, fun, BEAUTIFULLY animated romp through a chaotic cluster of dangerous worlds with incredibly tight gameplay that I am already very addicted to. And yet until a friend of mine mentioned it, I hadn't seen it in the store or had it recommended to me. I've even scoured Steam for new roguelikes and somehow missed it until now.

While not the hardest roguelike I've ever played, the game clearly has a TON of room to grow and will be adding a lot in the future. Ember Knights seems to be a genuine labor of love and I cannot wait to see what else the developer has up their sleeve, as the content already presented in this early access title is top notch. It made me a tiny bit sad to hit the wall on its current offering, but it took me just over ten hours and believe me, I WILL be going back. I was pleasantly surprised to find that after I returned to the over world, yet another opportunity for fresh, interesting gameplay presented itself to me. I poured my entire day into this game, and I STILL haven't seen all it has to offer, even in early access.

I could gush about this game all day. Do yourself a favor and play it!

．手　感 ✪✪✪✪✪✧✧✧✧✧
．規　格 ✪✪✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧
．難易度 ✪✪✪✪✪✪✪✧✧✧
．煩躁感 ✪✪✪✪✪✪✧✧✧✧
．中毒率 ✪✪✪✪✪✪✪✪✧✧
．推薦度 ✪✪✪✪✪✪✧✧✧✧


🟩 優點
．武器多樣性
．很多招式風格
．風格可愛輕鬆愜意


🟥 缺點
．連線品質
．手感偏卡
．Rogue強化手段少
．強化BOSS很噁心


🟨 心得
．遊戲非常可愛風格的類Rogue遊戲
　玩越久你越強
　但也很難用輾的
　除非你解鎖武器新動作才有機會
[strike]　雖然沒有中文
　但也還是看圖案挑選道具魔法
　不至於玩不下去 [/strike]

．武器風格都很有特色
　後期還能解鎖跟換動作招式
　新手可能弓箭會比較好的體驗
　期待未來後面更新的武器

．魔法的風格非常多種
　不同的套路會給予適合的裝備配件
　配上道具配件可以玩出很多花招打法
　研究起來非常有趣

．遊戲可以多人合作
　同樂性質很高
　但並不會比較好通關

．boss戰設計非常優秀
　每次的攻擊套路都會略有不同
　不會很難但也稱不上容易
　減少很多類Rogue作業的煩躁感

．手感方面偏小卡頓
　可能需要習慣一下


⬜ 後記
．以下是1.0版完整版的遊玩心得
　BOSS強化原本是期待的
　但幾乎都在招小怪堆怪
　砲火亂炸就是要炸到你

．然後明顯感受到第3關開始有點打不太動
　之前的體驗本到第4都蠻順遂的
　大概是防禦有提高
　好歹多一個攻擊力防禦力之類的技能樹讓我升等
　不然真的跟不上敵人的能力

．最終BOSS的煩躁難度只能說很噁心
　沒法好好專心打
　你可以做的攻擊節奏很難躲
　而不是小怪很多都給你幾個飛彈的難躲
　相信沒有人喜歡在那邊清怪
　而且招的小怪還是小王兩兩一組?
　只能說後期收尾部分製作組方向有點錯誤
　想看結局門檻實在太高
　這樣的成品我寧願回到之前到青蛙就停的版本
