115657973.review:
Fantastic game, I couldn't put it down until I beat all of the current bosses. I was able to complete the game's content in about 5 hours, but I'm sure there are some that could do it faster, depending on skill level. For $15 this seems like a great game for the amount of content.

The combat is really fluid, and getting the timing of the enemies is super important as it allows you to navigate the sometimes frantic fights. You can dodge around, and depending on your timing you can avoid enemy attacks. Dodging is super important in this game. There are several encounters that last about 15-60 seconds before each of the mini and main bosses. There was plenty of enemy variety and new patterns to learn in each of the new stages (or biomes). The mini-bosses even had several variations, which was a very welcome surprise! It can get really hectic and messy at later levels.

As for the roguelite aspect, it seems like most of the skills are useful in some way, but there are a few I generally avoided. I think that it could be expanded on, but as I was playing it didn't hinder my experience at all. You can upgrade stats and skills, collect gold for shops, and collect relics as you progress through each run. There is meta-progression as well.  

As of now there are two weapons, sword and bow. Others in the discussion board said that archer was overpowered, but I really didn't feel that way. After I learned enemy patterns, it really wasn't hard to go hack-n-slash mode, and the melee combat felt very fluid. Enemies were stunned after consecutive hits which made it easier on the melee mode. I actually preferred melee to ranged. 

I played a couple of multiplayer matches, and it seemed super smooth. No issues at all. Certain enemies do have dash attacks that will change at the last second depending on who is in range, so that could be frustrating, but once I was aware of it, I was able to just dodge anyways to be safe. I still think it should be fixed, though, for clarity and no cheap deaths.

EDIT: There are now 2 more weapons, a Staff and a Hammer.  The staff plays differently, more of a spell-casting influenced build, but haven't tried the hammer yet.

EDIT 2:   I will say that I haven't come back to it in a while, mostly because I feel like the mechanics and feel of the game are great, but literally the only thing lacking is the content. I need to jump back in for the newest boss, but I think that most people could get through it fairly quickly? Although you can look at my hours for reference. 

Another weakness is that IMO lot of the relics (not to be confused with powers) which provide passive bonuses aren't super interesting or game-changing, and another "upgrade" you can do is simple Stat bonuses, which are even less interesting because they bump up your damage or defence by a couple points.

115335458.review:
Easy to pick up Rouge-Like that's fun and rewarding to learn & master.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pros:

-Smooth, responsive combat & controls:
Ember Knights has very crisp movement, making combat very satisfying overall. Even though combat is quite limited, the good controls alone make up for this.

-Fair Difficulty:
The game gets progressively harder and begins introducing smarter, more well-rounded enemies which require a bit more finesse to defeat, making for a satisfying experience. Some enemies are capable of ending your run in a matter of moments, but attacks are well telegraphed and there's a fair room for human error in avoiding damage. Well thought out difficulty overall.

-Items and skills keep gameplay fresh:
The items and skills in Ember Knights feel very satisfying to use because they often aren't just flat upgrades to your character, and force you to adapt new and unique playstyles to accommodate for them.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Cons:

-Repetition:
Many enemies feel repetitive, and the variance of Elite enemies and Mini Bosses don't keep the game fresh enough in my opinion. The bosses have very repetitive attack patterns, the mini bosses and 1st boss in particular are the worst offenders. Having some variance to these fights will keep them fresh for players of all skill levels.

-Content Lite:
Game is Early Access at the time of writing, but feels content lacking at the time of writing. 3 Levels, all beatable within a few hours if you're good. Enemies don't have a lot of variety and the same can be said with weapons. After a few hours, the new car smell for the game wears off and the weapons feel very bland and unfun to play with.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Overall, I recommend Ember Knights. It's a fun game that's even funner with friends.

115287564.review:
그럭저럭 중독성 있게 잘 만든 게임. 그런데 문제가 몇 가지 있음.

  일단 게임 자체가 근접 혐오가 너무 심함. 같은 업그레이드와 같은 장비, 같은 스킬을 들더라도 근접한테 불리한 상황이 너무 자주 연출됨. 왜냐, 몬스터들 패턴이 근접에서는 피하기 정말 어렵게 설계되어 있고, 눈 질끈 감고 맞더라도 연속으로 처맞아서 순식간에 실피 남는 경우가 너무 잦음.

  게다가 시스템 자체가 근접에 불리함. 이 게임은 내가 유효 평타를 낼수록 스킬 쿨이 줄어드는 시스템을 차용했는데, 스킬을 자주 굴리면 당연히 스테이지를 훨씬 수월하게 깰 수 있고, 그런만큼 절대적인 타수가 적은 근접은 스킬을 자주 굴릴 수 없게 됨. 반면 원거리는 3타에 멀티 샷이 자동으로 나가므로 타수가 압도적으로 많음. 따라서 스킬을 자주 굴릴 수 있고, 스테이지를 훨씬 수월하게 깰 수 있음.

  상기한 타수 문제는 장비와도 연결되어 있는데, 이 게임의 장비는 크리티컬 시 어떤 효과를 받거나 적에게 해를 끼치는 효과를 가진 장비가 성능이 압도적으로 좋음. 물론 똥장비를 끼고 게임을 깨는 걸 좋아한다면 문제가 되진 않지만, 대다수의 유저는 그렇지 않다는 거임. 앞서 설명했듯, 근접은 타수가 적음. 밸런스 상의 문제겠지만, 이 게임은 스탯에 상한선이 있음. 체력은 100을 넘기기 힘들고, 크리티컬 확률은 30%를 넘기기 힘듦. 그럼 어떻겠느냐, 타수가 적은 근접은 크리 특화 장비를 가도 효율이 안 좋다는 거임. 그럼 근거리 특화 장비를 착용하면 해결되는 문제 아니냐고 할 수 있지만, 근거리 특화라고 부를 수 있을 만한 장비가 없다는 거임. 뎀감 장비나 처맞으면 피해 되돌려 주는 등의 장비가 있지만, 이 게임 몬스터들은 일반몹과 보스몹의 데미지 차이가 별로 없고, 일반몹은 나한테 다구리를 치기 때문에 일단 맞는 걸 전체로 하는 장비가 효율성은 물론이고 써먹기조차 힘들다고 할 수 있음.

  물론 주절주절 써 놓은 문제들은 원거리 무기 선택하면 전부 해결되는 문제임. 나도 근접 안 함. 그런데 그건 곧 게임 플레이의 다양성이 없고, 원활한 플레이를 위해선 특정 플레이 방식이 강제된다고 할 수 있는 거임. 이건 분명한 단점이지.

  하지만 을리 윾쎄쓰인만큼 향후 패치가 어떤 방향으로 이뤄지느냐에 따라 당연히 너무나 손쉽게 해결될 수 있는 문제라고도 봄. 일단 그럭저럭 재밌는 게임임에는 틀림없다.

115274160.review:
maybe it will be good someday, but not right now. severely lacking content. basic, and simply not ready.  3 main bosses, 3 mini bosses, with slight variations to their attack patterns. Why not have multi stage bosses? or why not have it randomly pick 1-3 unique bosses? look at most other games in this genre the bosses are random from a pool of potential bosses, look at enter the gungeon, look at binding of issac, look at neon abyss, all have this mechanic, its a mainstay of the genre. The ONLY sticking point to this game that you dont find in this genre often is multiplayer. Hitbox detection and collisions are poor. feels like you end up with the same builds over and over and if you're playing 4 players you're definitely going to have at least 2 people with the same build. Path selection is almost non existent, and the choices are always straight forward. 

Another issue i had was how the enemies target in multiplayer. The knight that dashes in stage 2, specifically In multiplayer. He charges for about a second and a half and if you go out of range he instantly targets someone else closer and they have no time to dodge. The expected behavior is if you move out of range of his agro, he would then refocus on someone and charge up again.  REMOVE THE FREAKING COIN SOUND EFFECT SO ANNOYING

Conforme você vai upando seu personagem, as fases também upam junto como se fosse um NG+. Apesar de estar em Early Acess, o joguinho está bem completo e caprichado, na minha opinião é um dos melhores jogos Roguelike de desse ano. I have to give it a thumb down FOR NOW.
Need many more updates in multiplayer.

I'll start with Cons here:
- Host and guest use the same save (Host's save) which mean if you spend time and upgrade on your own save, it won't link that upgrade when play in Multiplayer (If you're a guest).

Everything about this game so far is A+. The controls are solid. Levels are interesting with interesting bosses and mechanics. It's difficult enough to stay interesting, but not so difficult to feel insurmountable (I'm looking at you, hardest mode Dead Cells). The multiplayer mode is fantastic.

My only complaint is a minor one, and something they may well change for a final release: There isn't enough variety. You see the same levels and enemies in the same order every run, so it can feel repetitive after a while. It could use a branching map or some randomization to mix things up.

115224644.review:
Ein tolles Spiel.
Wie jedes Roguelite bietet das Spiel nach jedem Run eine Währung, mit denen man dauerhafte Verbesserungen freischalten kann, dadurch werden die Runs aber nur geringfügig einfacher.
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist eher bei Mittel bis Leicht einzuordnen.
Wenn man die Mechaniken der Gegner "gelernt" hat, wird es doch recht schnell sehr einfach, dabei finde ich den ersten Boss viel schwerer als die anderen beiden, die es zur Zeit gibt.
Die Zwischenbosse gibt es noch in verschiedenen Varianten, die dann auch andere Fähigkeiten benutzen.
Es spielt sich sauber und man weiß immer direkt, warum man Schaden bekommen hat und warum nicht. (Bei der Ausweichrolle wird ein kleiner Schriftzug *dodge* angezeigt).
Ich freue mich schon auf neuen Content.

115218410.review:
I would not recommend this game purely because it is a roguelite that misses the point of a roguelite. the rooms and runs are all on a pre-made set seed, this means that you will be doing the exact same rooms, same wave of enemies, same loot, same everything. The progression is far to slow and only having 2 classes which are very shallow in development if feels like just does not matter which one you choose AS AGAIN: SET LOOT AND SKILL TABLE..

There is too much left unexplained by the dev, i.e how bosses work, what enemies do. this along with some attacks do have a red circle before but sometimes this red circle does not show up which results in an unfair way to die in which youll do the same run again, not very fun, the loot is set seed aswell so forget about actually making a build or hoping for RNG. 

enemies and bosses will at random switch target from each player so you wont have enough time to react which the amount of damage they do is also very unfair.  

[summary, 15 EUR for an average of 3-4 worlds. with a set seed of same rooms and enemies and loot. .] The point of a game having a set seed implies that its meant for running through the game as fast as possible, while yes there is a sliver of rewards for doing so but again, the bonus chest you get for running through the game is also on a set loot table. until you add way more content or completely change the game for the better(take a look at other roguelike games, do they have a set seed of literally anything? no, they dont.) this is not worth 15 Euros at this time.

congrats devs, even on an early access title you completely missed your target audience and the point of a roguelite/like.

[edit: grammar]

115174527.review:
Fun game, would recommend. I have completed the game both solo and multiplayer with both weapons. Here are some thoughts:
Bow could use a damage boost, or at least keep the Power Gems the same value as the sword gets if you want to keep their damage start point lower.
I suggest increasing the Movement Speed gain for all drops and upgrades. Every other option is typically a better choice as it is. 
Allow for Cursor Customization (size/colour). In area 2, I swing/shoot wildly many times because it's hard to find the cursor in the colour scheme and chaos. 
Many times we've restarted as soon as we see the selection of spells that randomly dropped. For example, I really don't care for the bomb, so if I'm doing a run and that drops at the start, I would rather restart than play with it.
I think there should be more fire buffs or spells. Perhaps consider Chakram a fire spell since there aren't that many relics or skills for fire. Perhaps some more for poison ones too. Frost is already amazingly broken and fun if you can get the right upgrades.
Looking forward to more rooms and weapons. Well done so far. Cheers.

115097048.review:
I'd like to start off by saying this game is very addicting and fun! I had a great time with it. I finished the last boss available in early access on my 29th run after 20 hrs of play time. I am not a super talented gamer by any means but I do play a lot of games and have beaten similar games like Hades, and Deadsouls.  

Things done well : 
+The hit boxes are super accurate in this game and you never feel like you got hit by something you shouldn't have. 
+The dodge mechanic feels really good, super responsive, and it has a short amount of invulnerability frames to help you dodge through attacks  that would have otherwise hit you. There is a tiny amount of time after your dodge that you will remain invulnerable. 
+The enemies in each area look great and they are all unique to that area. There are no recycled enemies from area to area and you can really see the thought and effort the devs put in to the art direction and enemy variety.
+There are quite a few skills and relics and they are all fun to use and allow for you try to various builds, some more effective than others but I think there are probably at least a few builds you could get through the game with. 
+The controls on xbox controller feel pretty good and intuitive. 
+This game is challenging but fair, you always feel like you want to give it just one more try. 

The Negatives
-Although this game does tell you it plays better on controller, it would be nice if they could get the mouse and keyboard controls feeling better. They feel pretty janky compared to the controller. For some reason the commands don't feel as responsive. 
-If you have the ballista ability or wisp abilities, the enemies that charge forward in the ice area can appear to be locked on to your ballista and then they can switch to targeting you at the last possible millisecond and you can get hit by their charge. It feels pretty unfair because you can't really dodge it. 
-You cannot exit the game if you are in the middle of a run! You'll lose all your progress. I don't understand why such a simple game can't start you back up where you left off if you close your game. Runs can take 20-40 minutes and its heart breaking to lose your progress if you have to stop playing abruptly. 
-The sword weapon is just a little bit under-powered compared to the bow. Even though it does higher damage and you have higher health, it doesn't make up for the range and move speed of the bow. Maybe allow the sword to have some innate damage resistance or some other buff. 

Overall this was well worth the money spent. Good job devs.

115097030.review:
Highly recommend if you liked Enter the Gungeon and souls esque pixel games. Controls are good, the dodge isn't spamable and overpowered, it's more about timing which I love. I like the synergy with some relics and skills too. Very satisfying to throw a cyclone and round up the enemies then bombing them.

Only complaint is the sound of the coins. Sound cues from the sound effects are important for reaction times in these games, so I'm not going to "just turn the sound off," and when all you hear is *CLINK CLINK CLINK* from a few coins in a corner somewhere it's extremely difficult to hear anything else. Many times I've taken damage or died just trying to get the coins and making it stop.

Great game overall though. Thank you!

115072915.review: Its a fun little game. But still needs some work.

115065831.review:
FUN! Maxed out Hades a while back and this has been scratching that same itch. Some suggestions:

- Story is weak, and there is relatively little to do in the "home base". Guessing this will be more fleshed out as the game exits early access. Big shoes to fill here, standing in the shadow of Hades. 

- No equivalent of Hades gods' elemental effects on your weapon. This was a huge part of the fun for me in that game. What's provided so far pales in comparison to the intricate comboing & minmaxing in Hades. Perhaps there's an opportunity to do something radically different here to help the game stand on its own, such as ephemeral skill trees.

- Sword good, bow bad. Hades was fun because each weapon was balanced. Currently the game is too spammy/frenetic for the bow to be useful, especially towards the end of the 2nd area. Having pixel graphics does not help here (not that I expect the devs to change this; I love the art direction). When more weapons are eventually added, please give us some choices Hades did not. 

- Ember Tree has bad UI. Took me way too long to figure out that ONLY the single equipped buffs affect your playthrough. This whole thing needs to be redone.

- Forcing the player to simply wait x number of kills before earning the next relic orb is weak gameplay design. Perhaps there's an opportunity for resource crafting here?

- Rooms have far too few branch points. Some rooms have no bonus either. Hades knew how to do this right, by offering something (even if it was shit) in every next room, and offering many exits per room. This is a small fix that offers the player so much more agency in the game.

- Standard rooms go very quick, and boss rooms are comparatively very long. Perhaps you can meet in the middle to smooth out the game's pace?

- One of my favorite points of Dead Cells that Hades regretfully omitted was the idea of branching exits into a variety of biomes, some of which were only accessible after new abilities are unlocked. Any possibility to do that here? Hades was constrained by its source material but there is no such need to constrain here.

115028672.review:
So, after 50hrs of playtime and several updates later. I can safely say that this is a really good game. While in this genre offers nothing new to the table, nailing roguelite is tougher than it seems, especially making it fun for each run. Plus the addition of parameter adjustment like the enemy like HP size, Spawn count, and Attack Damage is a nice bonus for more "seasoned" player. They nail the gameplay loop with each run is not too long or too short, and plenty of upgrades along the way and few "special room" to spice things up. 

To me the highlight is definitely the build variety. Be it a DoT focused build, Crit dps focused build or immortal crit build, this game has plenty of build you can mismatch and use alongside your preferred weapons. Currently his game has 5 weapons, and each weapon has its own upgrade tree that can unlock another layer of mechanics.

This game becomes a lot more fun with friends, it is definitely the preferred way to play as it is in my opinion one of the better "party" game. You can just pop in, play few runs while drinking/chatting and you'd be satisfied. It never tries to be a "hardcore" or "sweaty" game, but also don't feel too easy which is a good thing. 
One thing to note, playing with 4 players can be a little too hectic, especially in the smaller room and if you tune up the enemy spawn to 200%. 

Honestly one thing that's not really a stood out for me is the music and gameplay sfx. Music wise, I can barely remember anything, while gameplay sfx like hitting with sword etc feels unsatisfying and lack of impact. It is not bad by any means, just it could use a little more oomph.

Also, so far the developer seems to be updating the game quite frequently, which is really nice to see. 

TL;DR:
Pros:
-Solid gameplay loop, with plenty of weapon varieties, each with their own combos and build.
-Solid boss battles, which definitely challenging enough without being unfair.
-Awesome build variety.
-Awesome "party"/multiplayer game to play with friends
-very polished

Cons:
-The music is rather generic/uninspiring
-The SFX could use a little more impact
-Not as complex as other roguelike/lite
-4 players session can be a little too hectic on the screen

114862443.review:
(Review made after completing the game once in singleplayer, and multiple times in multiplayer)

First, and most important, the game actually pulls off coop roguelikes to great effect. This is a kind of game that hasn't really had many good titles. Wizard of Legend was very good, but offline coop only - to play online you had to do some weird screen sharing to a friend. 

Ember Knights is a high quality game, with somewhat limited content as of this review. The game feels good to play, mechanically. A lot of games don't get this right but Ember Knights nails it. 

For content the game currently the game has 3 acts/stages, 2 main weapons, 12 abilities, and 62 relics. 3 main bosses, and 3 mid bosses, each with 4 variations. The production quality of the different sprites and animations is very high for its genre, and are fairly serviceable gameplay wise, though elites and similar enemy types can be hard to distinguish.

Aside from more content and general polish, I'd love to see some more options like high visibility cursors, lower particle effects, or other things to increase visibility. Overall the game is in a pretty decent state already, and I'm excited to see where it goes, because it's on track to be one of the best games in its genres (Roguelite and coop independently).

114640523.review:
This game is exceedingly fun. 

As someone who plays practically every roguelike imaginable, I've had this on my wishlist for months now. I was excited to play it when it finally dropped.

Essentially the game is a party roguelike. What do I mean by that? 

Well, its top-down gameplay is fun, but it can't compete with other top-down giants like ETG, NT, or Isaac. Now, it may in the future be better than some of those, but right now, no.

Here's the kicker, though: this game has one thing that those games don't. Official, online, not shitty multiplayer. Once I downloaded the game with a friend we had a run going in less than a minute. He lives all the way in the middle east, I live in NJ. We experiences a bug or two here an there (likely desync) but they were visual in nature, not gameplay oriented. It's been an amazing experience so far.

TLDR: The game is fun, has insane potential. Would recommend playing with friends (up to 4 online), as that is the game's strong suit.

114640468.review: Tons of fun, even more so with friends (but what game isnt). I like a lot about it. The enemy designs, the skills, the relics, the progression. However fighting the Herald is like eating a mouthful of mints then chugging ice water.

114639476.review:
A fun roguelite where what you see is what you get- in a good way. Emphasis on fast paced combat with coop, it's very akin to a game like Castle Crashers while being set in the roguelite genre. Very good for where it's at in early access development, I imagine the v1.0 will be pretty awesome if its already at this state.

A few tips that took me awhile to figure out that enhanced the experience, the white bar under their health is what stuns the enemy, they won't really get delayed by attacking them unless the bar fills up all the way, so you generally can't just fully execute your combo. You want to aim for using your 3-hit combo, which doesnt get interrupted by dashing or just doing a bit of staggered walking for a little bit. It has a little tolerance timer on when you can continue the attack sequence to get the combo finisher. Also, you can hold your skills to charge them and "perfect" time them for greater effect, which works very effectively for keeping the tempo going when you have to do something like kite while preserving the tempo for an attack.

114638914.review:

Also maybe change up the mini boss and final boss fights of each area to be different monsters so there is more of a challenge. Also add more rooms to go in each room. like one on the left and right side of the room so you can make more decisions on where you want to go. Otherwise very fun game I enjoy playing it a lot and it's pretty good at its state so far.

Music is well done and playing multiplayer is very easy to set up. Gameplay still feels fresh with the randomized rooms and items and hasn't gotten boring at all yet.

Only downsides I've seen so far is one time it crashed and rebound all my keybinds to default but that only has happened once. Also, for those of us on keyboard I find the cursor blends in and gets lost easily maybe add some visibility to that and itd be great. 

Deffo recommend this game if you enjoy rouguelike games:)

114596225.review:
Eigentlich war ich nur auf der Suche nach einem neuen Spiel für meinen 8 jährigen Hades Fan. Dabei bin ich auf Ember Knights gestoßen und bin selbst überrascht worden wie gut dieses Spiel ist. 

Das Spiel bietet schnelle Action ohne nerviges BlaBla. Die Steuerung ist sehr gut gelungen, gekonntes Ausweichen klappt perfekt und ist immer wieder die einzige Möglichkeit einem sicheren Hit zu entgehen. Besonders motivierend ist das zusammen Spiel von Items, Skills und Attributen. In fast jedem Run bietet sich die Chance auf eine geniale Kombi mit der man die Gegner übelst zerlegen kann. Dabei gibt es unmengen von Kombinationsmöglichkeiten die zum Erfolg führen können. Ein absolutes Plus ist auch das man mit bis zu 4 Spielern an einem Rechner spielen kann. Es macht einfach viel mehr Spaß mit seinem Sohn sich durch die Gegen zu bahnen als alleine. Wir warten schon ungeduldig darauf das die 4 Welt endlich hinzugefügt wird. 
Wenn ihr Spiele im Hades Still mögt ist Ember Knights ein Pflichtkauf.

114590154.review: Barely started playing with a friend and it's been amazing. You can really tell a lot of time, effort and passion has been put into almost every aspect of this game I'd want to argue. The game is simple, clean and straight forward. Yet still extremely rewarding. The story telling and visuals are amazing for a 2D souls like, as well as the replay-ability seems amazing especially for how early it is in this games life. If things continue to advance at this level of quality I cannot recommend it enough for the price tag. I've bought for about 4 other friends so far and am extremely confident they will like it as much as I do.

114587282.review: As the game stands currently, it is soulless. There's nothing except multiplayer that sets it apart from even indie roguelites. Everything is hyper generic and the gameplay isn't unique enough to warrant the price tag (factoring in early access). There's no huge synergistic payoffs like in other roguelites, and the game handles like a worse Hades, with none of its story or charm, and far less of its variety (again, hopefully an early access downside). This game has nothing over its competitors, and it wasn't difficult enough to provide more than three hours of gameplay for me to beat it. What's more is that I see no particular draw back in, as the runs don't vary by much at all. The game play is fun, but not as fun as many other possible time sinks.

114579488.review:
I've spammed this game over the past few days as a fan of the rogue-like / rogue-lite genre, and I have to say that there's a lot of potential in this game. In the current early access state in april 2022, it already has a lot going for it. 2d beat em up style combat with an emphasis on learning enemy attacks and squeezing in strikes where you can. The combat is also quite rewarding, but with minor querks. Although sword feels buttery smooth with great movement options like dash strike, perfect shot on bow is underwhelming, and feels more like it took too much inspiration from hades despite not being applicable in this more fast paced game. Other than that, the upgrades are solid, and I'm looking forward to see how the updates coming out affect the game. 

Tldr; Fun game, overall solid feel, definitely worth my 15$

114577397.review: Fast paced dungeon crawler with wonderfully mapped controls. The game shines best in multiplayer -  however, the singleplayer experience offers a chance to unlock permanent upgrades for your character at your own pace. Ember Knights manages to find its own colorful style and faster paced combat among other similar greats such as Rampage Knights, Lost Castle and Metaverse Keeper. The varied procedural levels and mini-bosses keep this game fresh and re-playable as a fun party game. Additionally, there are a slew of different skills and abilities to mix and mash so that your character plays differently on each new run. Hopefully in the future they design a system that rewards online play so that lobbies remain active long term, like in Streets of Rage 4. If you love challenging boss fights and the hair splitting action between your dodge rolls then this may be the game for you.

114574138.review: Really fun game! Lacking content, but that's expected for an early access game. Also, really wish the online co-op was a little more stable. But, I'm hoping this will be fixed along with the other bugs and nuisances.

114557666.review:
[table]
[tr]
[th]游戏由SteamPY鉴赏家提供[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/pyreview]SteamPY鉴赏家[/url][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][h1]上SteamPY淘海量超低价游戏[/h1][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[h1]可可爱爱的火花骑士[/h1]
作为一款肉鸽游戏，游戏明明可以靠着其可爱的外表赢得大部分玩家的喜爱，却还是用其丰富的法术，多样的道具，出色的打击感，舒适的翻滚手感和无敌帧证明了自己的实力，游戏小小的体量里却有着十分完整甚至出色的可玩性颇高的内容，支持最多四人联机游玩，虽然没有中文但是并不是很影响游戏体验，作为世界中仅剩的希望的火苗，拿起你的剑去拯救世界吧！

游戏整体体验十分不错，作为一款小体量的肉鸽游戏，本作不仅从画风上成功吸引到了我，还用远超诸多小体量肉鸽游戏的出色手感和翻滚无敌帧，让游戏的操作手感十分顺滑，再加上技能的设定，两者相互配合，十分流畅，但在操作中较为难受的是，弓箭在攻击时没有办法移动，如果只有单发弓箭射击就还好，因为时间快，大不了射击完再翻滚，但是弓箭的设定增加了一个第三下攻击射出多发箭，同时也就意味着玩家要呆在原地的时间变长，而在射击过程中是没有办法翻滚或是移动就变成了活生生的靶子，这点的操作让弓箭射击十分难受。

而游戏中技能，玩家可以携带两个，技能的冷却并不是随着时间的流逝，而是需要玩家攻击一定次数来恢复冷却，这样的设定缓和了无敌帧对游戏平衡性的影响，而在道具方面就游戏相比于其他出色的肉鸽游戏来说数量有些不足，玩家会遇见两种颜色的方块房间加成，一种是针对玩家的普通攻击的加成，并不给玩家道具，而是直接加成，一种是给予玩家道具，除此之外还有着法术房间物品房间，消灭所有怪物即可获得奖励。

真正让游戏困难的是游戏中的恢复手段有些少，游戏中不知道是我理解错误还是有着bug，在家中的升级有着进入房间回血，但是发现这个东西完全没有效果，还有着击败boss增加最大血上限也没有看到效果，十分的疑惑，可能是在介绍中并没有解释清楚，希望之后可以改正。或是推出中文。

游戏真正有趣的地方是游戏的多人联机，其快乐程度才是这个游戏真正的灵魂，单人游玩的话有着些许的无聊，因为相比下来较少的道具以及法术，虽然能通过捡东西解锁，但是数量并不是很多，需要注意的是游戏不能两个玩家一个人键盘，一个人手柄，十分让我难受。


虽然小但是五脏俱全，该有的不仅有了还做得十分出色，但是目前道具数量还是有些许的欠缺。
评分8.5/10

114479753.review: Ember Knights is *really* good. Really, really good. In a world of top-down action roguelikes desperately trying to reach the height of Isaac and Gungeon, Ember Knights sets itself apart by... not setting itself apart. The developers aren't trying to reinvent the wheel - they can tell what works well in games like Isaac, Gungeon, and especially Hades, and uses this to their advantage. The game is still very early in the roadmap (at the time of writing this, it's only been out for five days) but it has a ton of potential, and is insanely fun in its current form. Give it a try - if you like roguelikes like me, you'll want to snatch this gorgeous game up before the price goes up at full release, and to provide feedback to make a good game even better by release.

114467125.review:
Just attained my first full clear of the current three biomes.

This is a pretty neat game. I'm having fun with it, and can't wait to see more.

It is a bit easier than a lot of other roguelites I've played. This should be obvious by me having only 3 hours in the game so far. But I believe this is because the current three biomes aren't supposed to be the entire game, seeing as it's an early access title. Devs have already given a name for the upcoming fourth biome, and I get the feeling that's not the end of it, either. In terms of difficulty - to draw comparison to a popular game so the most people can get an idea - I'd put this game's third biome at around the level of Hades' second biome.

It also feels rather incomplete at the moment. The hub area doesn't have a lot of interesting things going on. There's two major NPCs to speak with, each presenting their own primary function to support you, as well as two weapons. The devs have stated that a third weapon is coming soon, though.

But the difficulty ramp is reasonable as it stands and the gameplay is rather solid for a brand new early access title. The price isn't too shabby for what's on offer. Most people will be probably be looking forward to at least 10+ hours for their first full clear, unless they get super lucky with their build. But if you're a hardcore roguelite fan like me, curb your expectations a bit; this will probably be a quick romp for you and not too tough at all.

114443356.review:
First of all the game is an early access title and it shows. For a roguelite there's a decent amount of content but at the same time it feels like there isn't enough variety. I hope they can fix that with updates. If that is something that bothers you then you'd probably want to wait until the full release of the game.

Now, the actual game itself is a visual treat. The pixel art is honestly amazing and the animations feel perfect. It makes the gameplay look great and combat feel snappy. I'm not the greatest when it comes to these sorts of action games but with Ember Knights I had no problem timing my attacks and dodging with okay timing. Each run you get to pick between a sword or a bow. Both feel great to use. There's a nice bit of building variety but your chances to make a build synergize on a run seem kinda low. Even then after the first 2 hours or so of playing I was able to hit the third map (last one?) fairly consistently (about 10 minutes per map) but every time I got there the miniboss of the place slaughtered me. In a way the game got a bit too easy but then I'd hit a wall with that boss because in particular he had one bullshit ability that I was too slow to dodge that dealt 20 damage when you usually have about 60 max health and limited ability to heal mid boss. That's where the lack of variety started getting to me. Doing the same two maps to get to the third got somewhat stale.

At the end of the day it's an early access roguelite. If that's your jam you know it.

114426442.review:
La verdad el juego me parece una maravilla absoluta, estoy muy emocionado con adonde puede llegar, la jugabilidad es excelente, las habilidades y poderes me parecen espectaculares, y el coop funciona de maravilla, no hay lag alguno,y me sorprendió mucho que haya tanto lore y animaciones tan elaboradas en la etapa early del juego (se nota muchísimo el cariño y dedicación en el juego), algo que me sorprendió bastante es el tema del arco, que se implementó super bien dentro de una jugabilidad tan frenética, al principio me costó adaptarme pero cuando le agarré la mano pude apreciar bien el por qué de cada cosa, se nota que las cosas en el juego están muy bien pensadas, no dejan nada al azar (o nada que vi hasta el momento)

Un tema importante a arreglar es el tema de recibir daño, ya que uno no se entera cuando es golpeado, no hay ningún indicativo más que el numero del daño recibido que es pequeño y desaparece rápido, no hay un knockback, no hay un indicativo en pantalla que recibiste daño, no hay ningún sonido y lo peor es que cuando tienes poca vida no pasa nada, la pantalla está igual cuando tenes toda la vida que cuando te estas por morir y es algo a arreglar porque me di cuenta que tenia poca vida al ver mis stats.

Fuera de estos detalles (que se entiende porque es un early) es un juego espectacular, muy entretenido, no es para nada aburrido, una jugabilidad envidiable, si quieres saber si vale la pena: si te gustan los rogue like este juego te va a encantar (la maravilla de jugabilidad recuerda un poco a Enter the Gungeon y Wizard of Leyend, para que se entienda la increíble jugabilidad que tiene)

114360845.review:
Edit: All of my cons have since been addressed in full release and their updates. Honestly a really fun co-op / solo rouge-lite. They've added a substantial amount of content, not limited to but including: weapons, skills, relics and colors. There is quite a substantial amount of content since my original review on release. Am very content with the content progress and current gameplay

A good little rogue-lite game. Its fun, i like the art and play style. Combat for the MOST part is pretty smooth. Worth 13-15 bucks for sure. Especially if the developers continue to add content

After playing solo and co-op some of my thoughts are:
 
Pros:
>fun easy to digest game with online coop
>Progression is straightforward
>Art is nice, music and soundscape are solid. 
>combat isn't easy but not overbearingly hard either

Most of my cons come from co-op, these include
>Only host is able to earn ember - essentially no progression is shared. including orbs and skill tablets. 
>When bosses drop skill buffs only 1 drops.
>Gold from destroyable items isn't shared properly
>Reviving is difficult should revive after mini-bosses or some other option
>Cant choose ember tree buffs, can only use the hosts. Should be able to use the ones from your own game as well. 
>Not a LOT of content but a good couple hours of plays worth (early access stuff).
>Latency

All in all in still having fun. My only gripes came from co-op for the most part. It just makes the experience less cohesive and not as enjoyable. Especially for players who want to play online without private lobbies. 
Only game breaking bug i've encountered is on the 2nd world, i rolled through a wall and clipped outside the map. 
i could not roll back in but could still be attacked (thankfully). 

Looking forward to the future progression from this game, it could really turn out to be a banger.

114301720.review:
Gameplay video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X1iynaF2Rcs&feature=youtu.be

Ember knights hikayesi ile gerçekten merak ettiren bir roguelike oyunu olarak karşımıza çıkıyor.

+ 1-4 kişiye kadar co-op oynayabileceğiniz
+ Mele ve ok olarak şu anlık erken erişim aşamasında yeterli olarak görebildiğim ( ilerleyen zamanlarda daha fazla seçeneklerin eklenebileceğini düşünüyorum )
+ Değişik formasyonlarda skiller ve seçtiğiniz silaha göre gelen relicler ki oyunda gördüğünüz ve keşfettiğiniz noktada çok başarılı bulacaksınız.
+ Mantıklı geliştirmeler ve NPC'lerin oyun içerisinde görevleri oldukça anlaşılabilir seviyede 
+ Mini Boss ve Bossların gerçekten oyun dinamiğine uygun gitmesi
+ 3 aşamalı harita , optimizasyon ve sanat çizimlerini oldukça mantıklı seviyede olması

Roguelike oyununda olması gereken bir çok şeyi barındırıyor ve erken erişim olması belki kafada soru işareti yaratabilir ama emin olun gelişmekte olan bir potansiyeli olduğuna inanıyorum.

Fiyatı gerçekten Türkiye şartlarında ucuz ve arkadaşlarınızla oturup zevk alabileceğiniz bu oyun kesinlikle oynamaya değer.

114286332.review:
A really fun game with a lot of content even for this phase in early access. I totally suggest picking it up, and can recommend co-op with one caviat mentioned below. 

At this point I've completed all relevant unlocks in 7.8 hours. Dev says it should take 10 for a good player and more for someone less experienced. So my experience roughly lines up with that. Despite having all current unlocks though, I don't intend to stop playing yet. I'm still having a blast co oping the game with my wife, and I look forward to playing future updates with her as well. Easily worth the 15 bucks it's at now, and the value will only go up. 

My only complaint about this game is that in co-op, only the host unlocks stuff. This is fine if you intend to only play co op, but I like to play solo too. The game also boasts the ability to join lobbies with random people, and it would feel bad to not keep any of that progress. I'm sure they will sort this out as we get closer to the final build, but in the mean time the best work around is to have your friend who is hosting the game send you their save file. You can copy and paste it into your game files, turn off steam sync by right clicking on the game in your library and going to properties, booting up the game, turning steam sync back on, and then closing the game. 

It's also worth mentioning that they have a roadmap up too that lays out their plans, and it looks like the full game should be out within a year or so. Always good to see a plan of action for an early access game. Overall if you dodge and slash rogue likes then you will probably like this one too, and it's one of the better ones I've played.

114267796.review:
Review:
If you like Hades or Dead Cells you will probably like this game, its fun and the gameplay is quite good for an early access. Hope that eventually they get new weapons/classes. I gameplay is great and easily replayable even after you clear the game completely. Co-op plays really well, and who ever is the host is where in the storyline you are so you can not progress self story unless you are the host and they can not join your game with their unlocks.

Co-op does have a small bug. If you are the host and die, some rooms that the other enters will stutter causing some map objects to either duplicate or be removed completely. So hopefully your best player is the host or you can get some really weird runs with shops having a stack of items or the enterence to the boss room not having food/gold. (Not a major problem).

Only complaint, is that players must be near the host if they want to upgrade base skills, reveal relics or unlock new skills. This can get really annoying if the host talks to the relic upgrader or skill unlocker and then forgets to continue or walks away since no one can interact or open the menu while the conversation is going and only the host can progress it. These aren't a major problems if you have 1 other player or are friends with the group, but if you have a public game I could see this getting really annoying.

** I have only played this with friends as of yet and its only been 2 players most of the time so haven't seen if this can get worse with 4 players**

Scoring:
9/10 (still early access, but is still better then most games that leave early access now days)

Price: 
Worth it (Can see it go up after it leave Early Access)

Will most likely re-review at a later date when I get more hours in (Most likely 100+ or when leaving Early Access)

114227972.review:
Do you want to play a fast paced, room to room rogue-lite that let's you skillfully dodge enemy attacks while you make small, non over inflated health bars go down while upgrading your character on a run to run basis and having some meta rewards upon death? Buy this game!

Your active skills are only on a cooldown for as long as you let them be. The way to recharge the (usually 10-15) cooldown is to use basic attacks. This game wants you to attack the enemies. Of course, if you take a second to observe what they do, you'll have an easier time. Or you can adjust on the fly as enemies have clear tells on when they are about to attack. Just watch out for a possible double attack. 

The meta progression has multiple paths to choose, and while you can only have one perk active in each category there is plenty to unlock and mix and match with to see what works best for you.   I had a really good time with Ember Knights. I found the fast paced, edge of your seat gameplay to be refreshing from all of the methodical games I've been playing lately. It is NOT a button masher, it's just fun. 

The devs are active on Discord, too, and they are interested in making a game for everyone while keeping true to their vision of fact paced, exciting action. I'd say they are doing a hell of a job so far.

Definitelly recommending this game.

I haven't played too much of this game yet and I can already tell it's gonna be a ton of fun. The combat feels fluid and smooth, the graphics look really pleasant and polished and it feels like there was a lot of love put into this game.

The difficulty, in my opinion, feels really well balanced. Challenging, but not frustrating. Most of the deaths felt like they were actually my fault, not the game's unfairness, and left me with a "Oh, I'll know how to defeat this enemy next time" reaction, getting me excited for the next run.

[strike] Only real issue I've had with the game so far have been massive slows while upgrading at the ember tree between runs. The rest of the game runs very well, but my frames drop REALLY hard whenever I open the upgrade menu. [/strike]

Can't wait for future updates!

EDIT: I've played this game for around 36 hours now and I still stand by everything I said in this review, except for the slowdowns while upgrading at the ember tree. It's been fixed and ever since I've had a pretty bug-free experience.
Another thing I'd like to add is the fact that all of the updates have been pretty frequent and well-made so far. The game is definitely worth its price!

EDIT 2:
Around 70 hours in. Still recommending this game, it's awesome!

114178696.review:
Gdzieś wpadł mi w oko ten tytuł w nadchodzących premierach Steam i oto jestem.
Nie grałem zbyt długo, ale już na dzień dobry mogę wystawić pozytywną notę z prostego względu:

Gra nie jest ciężka, owszem, wymaga w dalszym ciągu (jak to w Roguelike) nieco sprawności w unikaniu ciosów, ale nie na taką miarę jak w niektórych tytułach, np. UnderMine, czy Dead Cells, gdzie wydaje mi się, że poziom jednak jest większy.
Na czym to polega, z czym to się je? Otóż rozpoczynamy jako Tlące się Światełko, oczywiście w tunelu bez nadziei, które rusza na przygodę życia, by powstrzymać złego Czarnoksiężnika. Po drodze nie tylko zabijamy w proceduralnie generowanych lokacjach różnorakich przeciwników, ale także zbieramy pieniążki, które wydajemy na itemy w Sklepie, o ile żywi do niego dojdziemy, również pomiędzy lokacjami stajemy przed dylematem czy wejść w lokację bogatszą w złoto, czy zawierającą relikt, a może zwiększającą którąś ze zdolności Świetlika...?
Graficznie wygląda to bardzo dobrze, kolejny Indyk, który nie wymaga Bóg wie jakich kart graficznych, technologii, a cieszy ok, Pixeloza się nie wylewa ekranami, a jest przyjemnym dodatkiem, MineCrafta tu nie znajdziemy. ;)
Oczywiście po śmierci, co pewnie często będzie się zdarzać, wracamy do naszej siedziby w której się... Narodziliśmy. Tam za zebrane Embery możemy uzyskać ulepszenia samego Świetlika, jak i je wymienić, od Nas zależy, czy wolimy, np. z funkcji życia mieć po prostu premię, czy bez niej ale odzyskiwać ileś punktów co lokację, itd.
Osobiście jak na moje oko gra za 50 zł w dniu premiery z możliwością nie tylko online Coop, ale również lokalną kooperacją z przyjemną oprawą audiowizualną wręcz prosi się o kupno.

Dla chętnych materiału na YouTube zapraszam na nowo utworzony kanał (Stary YT usunęło...). Każdy Sub, Like, Komentarz jest mile widziany, oczywiście zapraszam także do wspólnej rozgrywki. :)

https://youtu.be/QX2YRkC16BQ

114176178.review:
This game is extremely fun!
It has a absolutely wonderful art style and is an exceptional local co-op game to play with your friends. 
The game play loop is quite fun and all of the enemies and allies look amazing.

Suggestions for Developers:
1. Make Arlan's patch match so it stays on the same eye between his avatar in the store and the big version next to the dialog.
2. Make it easier to revive your friends.  Possibilities include sacrificing some of your own life to save them, high-five to split life equally between two players (like Toejam & Earl), certain store items that revive them, reviving on mini-boss fights etc. 
3. Maybe each colored ember knight could have a name and a special ability or unique weapon sort of like the old Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle games.

114172647.review:
Welcome fellow gaming warriors to this latest review of Ember Knights which was an early free copy given to me to check out. The official release date is April 20th, 2022. Now that the embargo is lifted I am able to talk about my experience. Let’s get into this. 

Ember Knights Story:

An evil force has stolen the ember from the great tree also talking about the creatures around it. What will they do with the ember power, we have no clue at the moment. But, there is still hope as Esper has summoned you the Ember Knight to retrieve the Embers and stabilize the lands. As you go through the tear you will face off against the evil forces of Praxis who is our main villain in this story.

That pretty much sums up what you need to do and of course, your first weapon of choice is a sword. I mean, who doesn’t like a good sword to thwart evil? Now, it is time to jump through the tear and see what danger awaits you. 

Gameplay:

With your Ember Blade, you go through and head into Scoggfirth which I consider the grasslands of the area. As you progress you will face off against an assortment of enemies all doing different combat attacks. This is my solo run, but you can fight with three other knights in cooperative play which is great. As cute as this game is, it is pretty tough. Let’s get this out the way right now, you will fail a lot and have to start from the beginning. However, the stages seem to change on each restart. You do keep relics, embers, and other skills you have unlocked, but you lose items and drops you obtained during your journey. 

You will have to master timed attacks for example using the Ember Blade is more than just swiping around like a maniac. You can dodge roll into a lounge attack. Then when you unlock an ability that locks to Y and B. These will have cooldown effects that will cause devastating damage if used correctly. The power will reset once you start attacking enemies again. Some will have numbers indicating how many hits it will take to recharge. Between 10 to 20 and will have an amount you can use said move. So, think on your feet and use your abilities well as you will be swarmed by many enemies.

The occasional fork in the road is a nice touch. Do you need more Embers or do you need to replenish your health? The choice will always be yours but think because that next area could be a mini-boss and each time you die the mini-boss changes its abilities. Again, the game that is full of surprises is a lot of fun, because think about it! You going into a mini-boss fight thinking it will be the same outcome, but oh snap something is different. Now you just have to switch up your tactics. Or weapon when I finally unlocked a new toy, that made me go, “Ooooh what this do?” It was a bow and of course, I have potato aim when using it. However, it is versatile with a combo burst of shots after your first two shots.  

After the main boss fight, you venture off into a new area and unlock more relics which can unlock other abilities to enhance your stats as well. There is a nice RPG element to this game that I enjoy and even the countless times I have been defeated I just kept going. The toxic trait I have as a gamer is having tunnel vision and getting frustrated, which Ember Knights will give you that feeling. However, you will have the means to know what to do as you combat each enemy. At least until you get into a new area and then have to figure it all out. But that is the challenge of it, but I will talk more about that in another area. 

Visuals:

Ember Knight offers an A-symmetric viewpoint with a tight space as you go through the levels. This game doesn’t offer a jump button per se, but you can use your dodge ability to leap over games in the level. That is a fun feature to have, especially when you want to get away from an enemy since they can’t do that. 

Sound design is another factor that I am glad the developers took into consideration that brings everything to life full circle. The weapon clashes, monster sounds, and of course the music brings everything together to give fellow ember knights a fun experience. 

The Bad:

This is not really that bad, but it would be nice to have a checkpoint after you defeat a world. I was not expecting to jump all the way back to the beginning, but you are restoring the tree and talking to Esper, but let me jump back to the world I just died in. But again that is just my own personal feelings towards that small thing.  Also had an issue where sometimes health items will just disappear before I can grab them. For example, I will go to grab the health as soon as it pops up but then disappears. 

Final Thoughts:

Ember Knights bring in a fun new style to the Rogue-Lite genre with massive replay value. Helps you learn how to tackle each enemy differently and able to upgrade your abilities to deal more damage. Again I can see how the team-up element can work with this game, but hopefully, I can check out the co-op with some other players with both local and only 4-player co-op. It keeps you moving while also thinking on your feet and even though it is fast action you have enough breathing room to rethink things. 

Ember Knights get 4.5 out of 5 paws. Thanks for checking out the review and if you do plan to pick this up, we can fight Praxis together. - Beast Out -
